Reviews.Title: “clean but neglected”
Reviews.Author: peter e
Reviews.Content: its hard to be positive when on entering a hotel on check in,your ninety pound hotel room is debited for one hundred and forty pounds in case of damage to a room,which on entering looks like something from the set of life on mars.we have been asured however by the uncomfortably fixed smiley staff that only the ninety pounds has now been deducted as we left the room intact.positives were the room was clean and smelled fresh and an all you can eat breakfast was available(via a voucher from the reception,again a bit odd)for five pounds.

Reviews.Title: “Decent reasonably priced hotel”
Reviews.Author: jem8182
Reviews.Content: Overall there is a sense that this hotel was really lovely about 20 years ago, but now seems a little tired in places. The decor is dated and the rooms are in need of some TLC. However, my room was also clean, comfortable and spacious so I could live with some scuffed furniture! Location-wise the hotel is in a safe area and close to some really lovely parts of London such as Hampstead Heath and Primrose Hill. There are also some good restaurants within 2 minutes walk of the hotel. The staff were all very professional and the housekeeping staff in particular were very friendly. They had a deal on where you got two cooked breakfasts for £10 and this was a good value option with all the usual buffet breakfast stuff. On the whole the hotel is a good budget option for a lovely part of London and I would happily stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service”
Reviews.Author: sm0se
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a very comfortable stay at the Britania. The rooms were a good size and extremely clean although a little dated in places. Service was excellent - we needed an iron which was brought to our room promptly and when the hairdryer didn't work we were brought a brand new one within minutes. Beds were very comfortable and we slept well. We had breakfast in the hotel each day as part of our package and the choice was very good, with full range of cooked items, fruit, yoghurt, cereal, breads, cheese and ham and even porridge. Was slightly dissapionted there was no meusli but thats just me and some of the hot things looked as though they had been there a while but we did eat at the end of service and they tasted fine.Additional items such as fired eggs could also be ordered. We didn't eat in the resturaunt at night but they had a range of meals available from about £4 which is very good value. The hotel is a little outside of the main centre but because of this its generally quieter and there are very good transport links. It is 10 mins from chalk farm tube and buses can be caught to most places just a little bit further down Camden Rd. Camden stables market was a short walk away and we loved it. Also a short walk is primrose hill with views over London and Regents Park.

Reviews.Title: “The good points as well as bad! But value for money for London!”
Reviews.Author: wink_bink
Reviews.Content: Tuesday 13th - 15th March Arrived told our Room number 214 went up to the room upon exiting the lift saw a dog going in to a room (very puzzling) And the smell of stale cigarette smoke along the corridor! Put the key in the room (at this point very apprehensive) And pleasantly surprised although tired decor it was clean and plenty of room storage and very decent bathroom (bath filled within 5 minutes)! We ate at the hotel three times first we just had burger and chips (£3.50) very nice Bottle of house white was £9.50 again it was nice for the money! second night we had the all you can eat 3 course meal for £9.95 it was well worth the money and again a few bottles of wine and cider for the daughter! We also had the all you can eat breakfast which for 2 was £10.50 and was very good lots of choice and again well worth the money! It is not to the same standard as other 3* hotels i have stayed at within England but with it being the capital it was in safe area and whist it took 5 minutes walk to the Tube (Chalk Farm) it was again well lit and we felt safe! Would i stay again Yes for the same price i got - would i recommend to a friend Yes for a cheap hotel in london yes! Yet i am confused over dogs being allowed to stay!

Reviews.Title: “Cancelled Booking Nightmare”
Reviews.Author: RUSS1602
Reviews.Content: Booked well in advance for 7 rooms for 2 days. When I arrived was told that they had been cancelled by their central booking service. Nobody called or ever explained why. 5 of the rooms booked were twins and after 50 minutes wait, I was told that there were none available and we had to take a double room with a single put up bed. By which time it was getting late and there were few options available nearby for my party. Really felt let down.

Reviews.Title: “Shambles of a hotel, dirty old and tired”
Reviews.Author: ukpyro
Reviews.Content: I had the worst hotel experience of my life here. I had to call the police after having some of my personal belongings stolen from my room (the cleaner surely was the only person to access my room) I would suggest that the cleaners should concentrate on their jobs as the hotel is full of muck and mould, rather than going through peoples bags and stealing from them ! I had to call the police and of course the hotel did not make any concessions for me as they "dont accept responsibility for personal loss" of course there is little the police can do in a situation like this. I have stayed in hotels all around the world and ive never had a cleaner go through my personal items like they obviously do in this hotel. The hotel is well past its sell by date, it should have been decorated a long time ago, the carpets and walls in the rooms are filthy, the windows might as well not be there (they let the cold and noise in). Breakfast is full of items bought in a the lowest possible cost (fake rice crispies really annoyed me ! and the stale bread left out for toast. Overall i would suggest that if this was the last hotel in london, then book a room in essex instead, I will never rweturn to this hotel and i would suggest that others dont give them a chance to ruin your time in london with poor service and dirty rooms

Reviews.Title: “Would stay again....no reasons why not!”
Reviews.Author: Brambles0101
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 nights here on a mum and daaughter trip to London and have no negative comments to make and would recommend this hotel if you are looking for a clean bed, great location and a decent breakfast. OK, it is a bit tired in places but this did not affect our stay. Our check in was quick and receptionist friendly and helpful. We detected the stink of stale cigarette smoke as soon as we walked into the corridor but luckily our room was not same. Room was on the 2nd floor at the back of the hotel and had a decent view (avoid looking directly down and you will miss the venting system/pipes etc!) as in the distance we could see famous skyline of the City of London. The room was large, furniture slightly dated and had seen better days but had two very comfy clean beds, plenty of storage space with lots of hangers in a large fitted wardrobe. The bathroom was clean with complimentary toiletries and the shower was excellent. Breakfast was all you could eat buffet style and was perfectly adequate, coffee was a bit weak and the toaster contraption was to be avoided but otherwise we ate well the 3 mornings we were there. The only thing we found was the dining room was sweltering hot but the outside temps were well up for Feb (warm enough for short sleeves!!) so could be the heating system was out of kilter with the strange weather. Dining room staff were smart, efficient, friendly and well mannered. Location is lovely, residential area, felt safe and pleasant. A 7-10 minute walk to Chalk Farm tube and Camden High St. I would not hesitate to stay here again, great location, decent breakfast, clean comfy beds and friendly staff - at a decent price!

Reviews.Title: “london break with superbreak”
Reviews.Author: julie08051968
Reviews.Content: stayed at this hotel last weekend,fantastic value for money. the staff were so helpful and friendly. breakfast was nice and hot with a great choice , lovely location in a residental area but only a 5 - 6 minute walk from chalk farm tube. the room was very clean and comfortable with crisp white linen bedding.complimentary toiletries(its not often you get them in a 3 star hotel )i really dont know what people find to complain about, so what if the rooms are little outdated,or they havent got a plasma tv,if you want a boutique room then book a boutique hotel !!! will definately stay here again on our next trip to london

Reviews.Title: “london break & show”
Reviews.Author: kelvinuk
Reviews.Content: hotel was clean staff friendly but location was not good for west end etc two buses and tube change

Reviews.Title: “Good value convennient accomodation in central London”
Reviews.Author: BasilFrance
Reviews.Content: Central London on a budget, then this could be the ticket, you can get a dinner, bed and breakfast deal for around the same price as Travel Lodge where no meals are included. Yes as other reviewers have said the style is a bit dated, however my room was clean and it was great for just a stop over for my work. I appreciated the offer of continental breakfast delivered to my room as I had to leave before breakfast was served. As also mentioned there is parking, but limited and payable, however it is possible to park free overnight in surrounding streets which a re reasonably quiet and seem safe. My room could have benefitted from double glazing as the windows were large and it was a freezing cold night.

Reviews.Title: “good value for the area”
Reviews.Author: astramax151
Reviews.Content: Only stayed 1 night, as we were going to a gig at Camden Roundhouse. The Hotel is as hort walk from Chalk Farm tube + situated in quite a reasonable area, felt perfectly safe walking back to hotel in early of the morning. We had a basement room, which was nice + quiet. Room was perfectly warm enough for the coldest day of the year. Can't fault the room at all + breakfast was plentiful + varied (toaster didn't appear to have much impact on the bread though!) Reception staff were very nice + helpful too. We will definetly stay again next time we go to Camden.

Reviews.Title: “nice stay”
Reviews.Author: shammy1957
Reviews.Content: As always with Britannia hotels, this was tired....furniture scratched and everything looking well used and worn. However, it was clean , comfortable and in a fairly good location. Staff were etremely pleasant and helpful, nothing was too much trouble. The food was of a high standard ( tasty and well presented). Breakfast was really good, with plenty of choice and very polite staff.The couch bed in the room was a bit 'tired' and hard. Our request for extra quilts was dealt with right away. Staff even came and made it up as a bed for us. For Â£ 114 for three people, I'd say that was exceptionally good value for money, particlularly in London.

Reviews.Title: “Good location but needs updating”
Reviews.Author: Silverfoam
Reviews.Content: Very tired hotel needs to be updated no hot water at 18.00 when needed shower good breakfast No wifi in rooms

Reviews.Title: “Good value”
Reviews.Author: Lynnqa
Reviews.Content: Staff very friendly and helpful. Rooms very clean but need updating. Food very good value for money 3 course all you can eat buffet on a evening for Â£9.99. Overall good value

Reviews.Title: “Very Pleased!”
Reviews.Author: Rob P
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed at this hotel for a few nights from 9th February and were very impressed. The staff were very helpful and welcoming. Our room was on the top floor and afforded a lovely view of the local area with The City of London in the background. Primrose Hill is a lovely area and quiet. The room was very nice and clean - maybe a little dated but can't be faulted for that. Food was good and reasonably priced. Nice bar and dining area and excellent breakfast selections. Overall, will definately consider returning to the Britannia Hampstead!

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly surprised”
Reviews.Author: Richard O
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel for one night on a business trip. For the money in London I was not expecting too much but I was very pleasantly surprised. Yes, as with some of the other reviews, the hotel has seen better days but I found the room very clean and it had everything I would normally expect. It is a little noisy and the walls are a little thin. The bed was a little uncomfortable for me as I could feel the springs through it, but I slept okay. The staff were welcoming and very friendly. I ate in the restaurant on the first evening and for breakfast. It was self service on both occasions but the food was tasty and good value for money. For cheap accommodation near the tube this is fine. I will stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Theatre and sight-seeing break”
Reviews.Author: AndrewandGill
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for a couple of nights on a theatre and sight-seeing break. It was relatively easy to get into the centre of London, but was nice to be able to stay in a pleasant residential area. The building has seen better days, but the room was warm and comfortable. The staff were welcoming and friendly. The breakfasts were excellent with a comprehensive choice of food and drink. We ate in the restaurant on one evening. The meal was self service, but was tasty and good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Basic and cheap but I wouldn't stay again”
Reviews.Author: AMPH
Reviews.Content: I was concerned when I read the other reviews, I hadnâ€™t made the booking for this hotel and did try to get our group to stay somewhere else, but the booking had been made. The upside: very clean, good shower, big towels, helpful staff and very cheap. Room includes hairdryer, basic shower gel, soap, kettle, tea & coffee. The downside; single glazed windows which means itâ€™s noisy, rooms are very faded, old furniture which is crammed into the room, the walls are paper thin and you can hear people in the next door bathroom. Broken chain lock on my door (317) but I didnâ€™t notice until Iâ€™d arrived back after supper and I was too tired to start moving rooms. I think the corporate rate we secured was Â£60 inc VAT and breakfast which is incredible for London. If you are looking for cheap accommodation, not too far from a tube (Chalk Farm on Northern line) this is fine. Personally, I wouldnâ€™t stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Spacious & clean rooms, quiet neighbourhood”
Reviews.Author: Jacqueline M
Reviews.Content: What I immediately liked about this hotel is the spacious rooms - at least on the first floor. The bed was big (though not the most comfortable I've slept it, but it'll do) and the room featured a couch and coffee table, as well as a little foyer. It was great for slowly waking up and having coffee. Each room has a kettle with an assortment of teas and coffee with little packets of milk, which I REALLY appreciated. There is a spacious bureau to unpack and a closet. Hairdryer is included and is key for traveling light. The neighborhood was quiet and felt safe. The hotel is about a 10 minute walk from the Chalk Farm tube stop, which was lovely and just off the path enough to relax. It's a 15 minute walk to the London Zoo and Regents Park, which were both lovely. The maid service was really good. Fresh linens daily. Walls are thing - it's a little too easy to hear the neighbors through the door between hotel rooms. But, of course, this just depends on who you get as neighbors - a few nights we had quiet neighbors, and a few nights we had late night party people. Just bring a pair of earplugs or if you're on holiday like we were - stay up late and sleep in late. I would definitely stay here again. The price is modest and the service is good.

Reviews.Title: “room without a view”
Reviews.Author: Carol199
Reviews.Content: This was the worst hotel bedroom i have ever been offered in a hotel. Our room did not have a window and when I asked for a different room I was told that the room I was in was in one of the hotels better rooms! After changing to a room with a window albeit a much smaller room i went to the bar to order a diet coke, After the bar lady had poured me a drink i asked her to put it on my room, she said after checking that i did not have any credit for my room,I said that i had given my credit card details to reception, she shrugged and i explained i had no cash on me, so she poured the drink down the sink.

Reviews.Title: “Superb Location”
Reviews.Author: Denton50
Reviews.Content: I thoroughly enjoyed my stay at the the Britannia Hampstead. Its location between the Hampstead (with all its attractions) and Primrose Hill areas of London is really superb. The real bonus with this hotel is that it has a limited amount of on-site parking which is almost unheard of with the more central London hotels. Even if the hotel's own parking spaces are full there is plentiful alternative parking in the vicinity. Central London is accessible by public transport. The staff were friendly and helpful and my room was clean and comfortable. If the decor was a little dated and the shower room rather small, it was still good value for the price. The only slight problem I had with my particular room was some background noise which I think was from the lift, but this did not stop me sleeping as I was always tired after a lot of walking and sight-seeing. For anyone planning a trip to London and looking for a reasonably priced hotel which has parking facilities I can thoroughly recommend the Britannia Hampstead.

Reviews.Title: “Very pleasantly surprised”
Reviews.Author: Pierre M
Reviews.Content: Stayed there last weekend along with 13 of family for nearby wedding, bit worried having read the few bad reviews as I had suggested this hotel to everyone. The staff were very polite, attentive, and helpful. The duty manager was hands on and seemed always present. It seemed to be one of my beloved old THF Posthouses from the 1980's with all the original furniture (including corby trouser press) vast amount of drawer and wardrobe space. It's a bit scuffed in places but everything was clean, the beds were more recent and fine, the shower was ancient but very good and the hot water plentiful. Breakfast was very good. Bathroom lacked shelfspace and will need updating soon,as well as the old aluminium windows. Overall very pleasant and very good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “not a great choice.”
Reviews.Author: mark f
Reviews.Content: This particular hotel does require updating in many ways. Some of the reveiws are quite scathing however it depends what you need to use the hotel for. If you are working and require reasonable rates plus easy transportation links to central london then this could be for you. Myself and my son has just stayed for three nights whilst working in London. The accomadation is pretty standard but adequate. There is even a table which you can stand the 1970's TV set on so you can both see the television. It might not be 70s but its old. I would NOT personally use this hotel if I was planning a weekend break with a partner because I think you would be dissapointed. Lots of contractors do use this hotel as it will normally fall within the company budget. As a non smoker I had to change rooms from the 1st floor where the smoke from the smoking area outside the reception funnels up the staiwell and is quite strong. I suspect also that staff smoke in the bottom of the stairwell so the do not have to go outside. It is January and cold so summer may be different. There is cheap food available which we tried but you get what you pay for.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice stay.”
Reviews.Author: jonandsueBelfast
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel 6-8th Jan 2012. I have stayed at the sister hotel in London Docklands but it was sold out, so thought I would try this place. I was a bit nervous after reading on here but thought it can't be that bad, and in all fairness I found no fault. I went to check in and was asked if I wanted a complimentary bottle of wine!? We had a basement room which was fine because we were only there to sleep, it was very clean and had all that we needed. As we were getting ready to go out a waiter brought a bottle of wine and two glasses to our room. We went to reception and asked the young chap for info on the new shopping centres in London, ahhh let me get Denise, Denise came to the desk and told us how to get to Westfield London and off we went. We had dinner out, but had a few drinks at the bar upon our return at night which were very cheap for a hotel in London!!! Breakfast was traditional english or you could have cereals etc, plenty to choose from. LEft our bags with reception on second day after checkout until we came back from Cambden. We had a great time and I would go back again but would stay longer as this side of London is not one we have explored much

Reviews.Title: “Lovely staty in a nice quiet hotel in a very nice area”
Reviews.Author: Vinyltop
Reviews.Content: I have just retyrned home after a lovely 5 night stay in Britannia Hampstead. On arrival, I was met by a very helpful reception staff member and asked if I would like a complimentary bottle of wine which was an offer they were doing. It was a nice surprise. I went out and upon my return to m y room that night there was the bottle of wine in an ice bucket along with 2 wine glasses! My room was lovely. I was on the 4th floor at the rear of the hotel with a huge balcony overlooking central London in the distance. Yes, the decor in the roomwas perhaps dated, but, it was spotlessly clean as was the bathroom and all bed linen and towels were changed every day of my stay. there are also some shower gels, hand soap and body lotion in the bathroom. The buffet breakfast had a nice variety to choose from. On my second last day I had a friend coming to stay with me so the staff were very obliging and moved my luggage to a twin room on the 2nd floor. This room didnt have a balcony but it was equally clean. Contrary to some posters, I cannot fault this hotel at all. The local area is very nice. On Englands Lane around the corner, there is a Tesco Express, some restaurants, cafes, launderette,starbucks and The Washington pub is gorgeous. there since 1635, it is a lovely spot to chill out inplus they do some lovely food and alternative ciders & beers. The whole area is very quiet and has a village like feel to it. I'd definitely stay in the Britannia Hampstead again.

Reviews.Title: “Fawlty Towers is five-star luxury in comparison”
Reviews.Author: AmieJames
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I booked this hotel for his birthday because we'd stayed in many Britannia hotels before but never have they been so disappointing. We caught the train to London Euston and the tube to Camden Town and it was a fair walk from there, especially with suitcases. We saw a building ahead that according to google maps was the hotel, but we thought they were run down council flats. It was the hotel and it looked disgusting. The outside walls and windows were dirty and clearly they only worked on the appearance of the main enterance and even the revovling door was a nightmare as it was too small for our cases. It took over five minutes for the receptionist to explain the details of breakfast and just from the appearance of the lobby, we knew it was going to be dissapointing. There were advertisements for wedding packages at the hotel, who would want to have their wedding in a place like this?! We got into the lift and went up to the second floor where we had a smoking room. Our room was at the very end of the corridor and as we walked down, the lights flickered like some sort of horror movie. We opened the door to the room and as usual, were greeted by 90s student decor and upside-down framed paintings nailed to the wall. The mirror at the dressing table was too high up so you couldn't sit down and use it. The full length mirror was in the wardrobe and there wasn't enough room to open it as the dresser had been put against it. The tv was in the corner and not at an watchable from the bed. There was no ash tray so we had to call reception to bring one up. In the bathroom, the shower was broken, there was mould on the ceiling and only one bath towel for two people. The room was stuffy and we couldn't open the window as there were no directions and it wasn't your standard window, so we had to call reception again. We noticed Continental Breakfast cards on the bedside table and thought it would be nice to have breakfast in bed as we were going out that evening and returning late. It said that they needed to be hung on the door before 5am, so we hung them on the door at 11pm before we left. We came home at 4am and went to sleep in the uncomfortable bed. We woke up at 9:45am as we had asked for breakfast to be brought up at 10am But when we checked the door, the cards were still there. We rang reception and the woman on the desk spoke to us like we were stupid saying that we needed to have them on the door before 5am, which we did. When our breakfast finally arrived, it was brought up by the manager who apologised for the delay but demanded we pay an upfront Â£4 tray charge which was not stated on the Continental Breakfast sheet. We'd ordered cereal, toast, yoghurts and drinks, but there were no yoghurts and no butter for the toast, so we had to ring reception again and the manager brought us some butter but said there was no yoghurt left. If he had explained that to us when he gave us the tray rather than just leaving it, we wouldn't have had a problem. He said he'd compensate us with something else, but nothing has arrived. I'm actually sat on the bed in the hotel writing this review and we still have another night here. They don't offer refunds unless a staff member is abusive to you so there's no chance of us getting put Â£110 back, but in all honesty I wouldn't pay Â£15 for this hotel. Funnily enough, Fawlty Towers was on the tv whilst we were getting ready to go out. It looked like luxury in comparison to what we had.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT TRIP GREAT HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: djmfromkdy
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 2 nights on new years eve and new years day we booked it as a package which included our train tickets and had such an amazing weekend in london, we travelled with our two friends who both had an amazing time too the hotel was perfect situated in primrose hill which is only a few tube stops from kings cross the breakfasts were awsome the rooms were clean and the staff were so helpfull the washington bar which is 2 mins walk from hotel was where we spent the night bringing in the new year and had such a laugh with the locals, dont get put off by the reviews on this site five star it is not but value for money and location it is perfect, we will be back to london again soon and will be staying here again....

Reviews.Title: “Another lovely Christmas holiday”
Reviews.Author: JayPortsmouth
Reviews.Content: This is our third Christmas at this hotel and we had a lovely time. Once again it was wonderful value for money. We upgraded this year so our room was really nice. The food was excellent, the staff friendly and helpful and because it was our third visit we were aware of the bus timetables to all the places of interest. It also meant we could go to Camden any time we fancied, (I love Camden)!! For us it is a great base. The entertainment was basic but after a full day we were happy to just sit and listen to the music provided by the DJs and chat to the other guests. I can`t wait for next year when I really hope we are able to go again. Thank you for a great time.

Reviews.Title: “Worst hotel iv stayed in,”
Reviews.Author: 8pinky
Reviews.Content: It was mine & my husbands 1st new year together, cause of work commitments in the past, so looking forward to going to London, what iv always wanted to do, so we thought we was going to have a great time at this hotel, it was the worst ever, it's such a mucky hotel, staff are very rude, & food well don,t even go there, & new years eve disco/party was a deastarter, there was 8/10 people there, it was the worst new years ever. Never again, don,t go to this hotel, 3 star, more like a 0 star, not a happy bunny,

Reviews.Title: “Terrible hotel”
Reviews.Author: Matt M
Reviews.Content: I stayed here on new years eve and I would definitely not make a return visit. The room was filthy, stains all over the carpet and spare toilet roll seemed to have dried urine over it. Service wasn't great; the night porter was rude and there was only one towel in the room. Hotel decor was very dated and was woken up by a fire alarm randomly going off in the morning. Overall I think this is possibly the worst hotel I think I have ever visited.

Reviews.Title: “Good Christmas Break”
Reviews.Author: carron5
Reviews.Content: On arrival staff very helpfull and freindly,room nice and clean could do with a referb. All food very good with a wide choice. The manager was very helpfull & polite, Had avery good christmas with all the other guest's thank you for a great time.

Reviews.Title: “Safety Concerns”
Reviews.Author: MidlandsRascal
Reviews.Content: We spent a weekend here for Christmas shopping in London. On arrival we were shown to a basement bedroom- no windows but so what? Afterall it was a shopping trip! With no way of getting out of the room other than by the lift or stairs, I was very concerned to see that the space at the bottom of the stairs ( a protected area for fire prevention and escape ) was filled with conference style chairs. In addition, the fire door was regularly jammed open as the door closer was too weak to close the door against the resistance of the carpet pile. In bringing this to the attention of the duty manager on Saturday morning, he was very polite and apologetic, asuring me that this would be corrected by Monday at the latest. We left on Sunday afternoon with no change in the situation. I did wonder if such an approach to my safety would spill over into other areas? I therefore checked the electrical testing of the items in our room ( the so called PAT testing).This was unsatisfactory with some items not showing any registration details, others had registration lables but showed neither test date nor expiry date. I have to score all the items including service etc as terrible, on the basis that if a hotel cannot fulfil its basic safety obligations then all other matters could not be satifactory. We found the staff polite and helpful, it is my theory that they are let down by management.

Reviews.Title: “The Best Time Ever”
Reviews.Author: happywomen
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a fantastic four night Christmas package at Britannia Hampstead Hotel. This was one of the best hotels we have stayed in in London. We had the perfect holiday and couldnt fault the hotel,room or staff. The food was out of this world and for the money it cost,it was amazing.The bar prices were lower than many pubs and the entertainment was brilliant. Many of the guest got together and ages ranged from 7 up to 90 years.We all partied and enjoyed. It was so good that many of us have re booked for christmas 2012. A big thank you to Manager Mr Inderpreet Singh and the staff who couldnt do enough to help. Also a big thank you to all those lovely people we met up with and look forward to seeing you all again next year.

Reviews.Title: “Good generally, choose based on type of trip”
Reviews.Author: EmmaLP11
Reviews.Content: We stayed twice - 3 nights in Nov an 1 in Dec. great location as down the road from our friend's house. Can't recommend beyond this and would suggest doing your research as there are places closer to tube stations and attractions. Great for families and groups more than tourists. Overall, nice staff and very clean.

Reviews.Title: “Good value and good location”
Reviews.Author: PhoebeDevon
Reviews.Content: We stayed here as part of a Theatre break package and, having read some of the reviews, I was a bit apprehensive. But I was pleasantly surprised. Sure, its a bit tired, but if you are getting back late and just want somewhere conveniently located, that's clean and tidy, then there's nothing wrong with this place at all The staff were very friendly, efficient and helpful. Continental breakfast was included in our package and you could upgrade to a full english if required. On site parking at Â£10 for overnight is very cheap for this area too!!! Unless you are very fussy and are planning to spend a lot of time in your room, then it's good value.

Reviews.Title: “Christmas lights In london”
Reviews.Author: Cool_Gran
Reviews.Content: We stayed for two days at this hotel, It was very clean and comfortable, The staff were very helpful,the only down side was there was no room service so if like us you wanted extra tea or milk you had to go down to reception and collect it yourself, not very good when it's first thing in the morning and you want a cup of tea before you shower and dress. it's location is very good 10 min walk to the underground where you purchased an all day ticket for Â£6 that allowed you to travel on the subway and buses till 4-30 in the morning. we found found O'Neils bar in regent street did good food at a reasonable price

Reviews.Title: “Reception man let himself into my room at 4am”
Reviews.Author: Joy E
Reviews.Content: As a lone woman being awoken at 4am by a man in the room was close to terrifying. Seemingly the reception man had "accidentally" let himself into my room at 4am. He accidentally picked up the keys, accidentally walked to the door and then accidentally opened the door! Calling the police was close to my mind once I had calmed down but by then it was morning and having an important business meeting which was largely ruined by the shocking treatment. I advise anyone reading this to stay anywhere else. it clearly shows a shocking lack of controls with total and utter disregard for guests

Reviews.Title: “in desperate need of a refurbishement”
Reviews.Author: Hils160
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel as part of a two night stay with Thomas Cook superbreak mini holidays. Definitely not worth the money. We were on the first floor, the corridor was dreary and our room smelt like the toilet rims that you put down the toilet. There were stains on the chairs & bedside cabinet, scratches on the dressing table and bedpost, scribble on the wall, carpet didn't fit properly and was stuck down with tape. The old fashioned television didn't work properly and after three requests to have it fixed, it was replaced with another, presumably switched, with one from another room!! and then put back on its wobbly stand. The whole hotel is stuck in a 70's timewarp and is in definite need of a refurbishment. With the olympics coming next year this hotel will be an embarrassment.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel. Buy 2 pints, and survey the scrambled eggs!”
Reviews.Author: Lord_Williams
Reviews.Content: Really nice hotel, 5 minutes from Chalk Farm tube station. Had a smashing little room (No 10) in the lower ground. Free wi-fi in the bar area. Very good attentive staff, but I did have to wait a bit to get a pint late at night as the "night porter" tried to juggle being a receptionist and a barman. Plentiful self service breakfast but watery scrambled eggs. Would I stay here again? Too right I would.

Reviews.Title: “Not quite there”
Reviews.Author: Peter W
Reviews.Content: Spent three nights at the hotel during business trip. Service first class and breakfast excellent. The room was basic and in need of refreshing. No wi-fi in rooms which is a drawback for business, though free wi-fi in bar. Clientele included many tradesmen staying in London filling early breakfast shift. No problem for me, though could be a bit unnerving for a lady on her own. I guess that the clientele sums up the hotel - fine, clean and good service but at the value end of the market.

Reviews.Title: “Worth and pleasant experience”
Reviews.Author: Thomasrv
Reviews.Content: Though this hotel don't have high ranks as it deserve, My experience has been very pleasant. Quiet (because of its location), cleanliness, and all good facilities in the room, and above all the pleasant behavior from the staff ....all these gave me a peace and pleasant stay...I would suggest anyone having holiday trips or for london visits to be here .... Most of my London trip had been based on the details given from the staff at the reception, and it included much to have my London holidays get planned well for my limited time span.

Reviews.Title: “seedy”
Reviews.Author: glasgowgigi57
Reviews.Content: this is a pretty seedy place in a good location. It is actually clean but it is so worn out, it is hard to see that. It needs to be gutted and redone but since it is owned by the same outfit that own Pontins, I doubt that will happen any day soon. Because it is so cheap, it attracts a visitor like no other. It is all so run down and second rate that to my mind, it would be better to stay in a 2 star guesthouse if you can afford no better.

Reviews.Title: “3 Day Weekend Theatre Break”
Reviews.Author: RAHEastAnglia
Reviews.Content: General appearance and cleanliness of Hotel was as expected and good enough. The Full English Breakfast was excellent. The Bar was average, prices reasonable but hotel severely undermanned at weekend so Bar person was often absent doing " other jobs". My main objection was that while we were there not one member of staff had English as their first language. Their work ethic, politeness and appearance could not be faulted but I could have been in any hotel in the middle or far east, (As I often am for work) and I did not expect it in England.

Reviews.Title: “Paintings...”
Reviews.Author: dan w
Reviews.Content: We first stayed in the hotel on the 15th of October for 2 nights. At first we thought the hotel was a little bit worn, however the main reception staff were friendly and approachable. The rooms were decent, but the un-nerving paintings in the bathroom which seemed to watch you whilst you showered were quite disturbing. If you have a fear of being watched whilst you're showering then I wouldn't advise you stay at this hotel. The breakfast was enjoyable and on the whole, the stay was pleasant.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant Surprise”
Reviews.Author: MJGDARL
Reviews.Content: Booked as part of a 2-night Superbreak package (including rail on east coast line). The suggestion picked up from other tripadvisors to ask for a high room at the back was sound (a must in my opinion) - its about the view! (over-looking the skyline of London/lit up at night) The room to be honest although recently updated was basic but comfortable, all you need really for such a break. A word of caution: if you want the high position over-looking London remember that this hotel is located on a promontory position, so to those who have difficulty walking - it is an uphill 10 minute walk from Chalk Farm tube station. If you are a first time visitor to London perhaps not the best of locations but otherwise if you can navigate using the transport options then I would have no hesitation to say that this site is sufficiently close to gain access to central London within a reasonable time with the benefits of feeling like a suburb. If like us, you spend lots of time out sightseeing; then the breakfast is important - I can confirm that this is a true positive (help-yourself buffet style) with plentiful option for all tastes. You are on top of each other in terms of seating but this we found pleasant and would not have gleened valuable bus information from a couple from London who were visiting son, perhaps without this snug layout. (C11 bus from outside hotel takes you to Swiss Cottage tube station) Another highlight for us was the position to Camden Town, Camden Market & Camden Lock a lovely option to have something to eat and drink within reasonable distance from which to travel back to hotel The staff were, as previous reviews highlight; are very attentive and helpful. I would have no hesitation to returning to this hotel for a similar break again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location - Great Value”
Reviews.Author: Qwerty9090
Reviews.Content: This is an ideal hotel for someone stopping in London who wants a good base to get out and about. It is located closely to both Belsize Park and Chalk Farm tube stations. It is clean with good, helpful, friendly staff. The area in which the hotel is situated is very pleasant and has some good pubs quite near.

Reviews.Title: “'Very handy location”
Reviews.Author: KarenLancashireUK
Reviews.Content: We have just spent two nights in the Brittannia Hampstead Hotel. The location is excellent, just a ten minute walk to the tube or fifteen minute walk in to Camben. The staff were very nice and they allowed us to check in early (1pm)as our room was ready which was handy. Unfortunately, I think the hotel could do with a bit of a spruce up as things are a bit outdated and tatty. Our room had seen better days and we had to ask for one of the pillows to be changed because it had hair on it and was wrinkled and obviously hadn't been. It is all a bit tired really, carpets with threadbare bits and stained furniture and very out dated televisions. The food was OK but nothing to write home about, we tried the cooked breakfast the first morning but ended up with just toast on the second morning. I dont really expect luxury at the prices you pay for these sort of hotels but I think if chains like travel lodge always maintain a certain standard then that it what you should expect to get.

Reviews.Title: “Clean & good breakfast.”
Reviews.Author: missfartastic
Reviews.Content: Stayed in 24th Oct for 2 nights. Hotel was clean & tidy. Rooms were nice. Had a good breakfast. Staff couldn't have been nicer.

Reviews.Title: “No problems but could do with tarting up”
Reviews.Author: Tufc1
Reviews.Content: Stayed for a 5 nights in April and the hotel was fine. Yes, the rooms do look dated with old furniture and decorations but ours was clean and comfortable as was the bathroom. The breakfast was very good with plenty of choice. Its in a good location - 10 minute walk to the tube and just a couple of minutes from the local shops.

Reviews.Title: “Not the Ritz but good value for money”
Reviews.Author: John K
Reviews.Content: Stayed for two nights over the weekend, following concerns regarding the reviews on some web pages, I rang the hotel on the Thursday night, to check what room we would be allocated. I was told that rooms had not been allocated at that stage, so I asked to be given an upstairs room not on the main road side. When we checked in we were given a Plaza room on the 5th floor, splendid views over south east London and no one over us to make a noise; result. The bed could have been a bit better but after walking around London all day it did not stop me sleeping. The curtains etc. were more than a bit worn, but the room was clean and the staff we dealt with were generally helpful and polite.

Reviews.Title: “London Weekend Break”
Reviews.Author: NSBNE3
Reviews.Content: My partner and I did a Superbreak deal and stayed at this hotel for two nights.. I looked at the comments people had made and to be honest I was not expecting very much. However, it was much better than the reviews. The staff were friendly and helpful We had a room on the lower ground floor which was adequate for our need. The bed was comfortable and clean. The bathroom obviously has not long been done, only criticism here was that you had to shut the bathroom door when you had a shower otherwise the alarm would go off. There was a note in the bathroom to this effect. However, my partner could then not see in the mirror to have a shave which he did not like. The breakfasts were ok and the staff could not have been more helpful./ Overall a very pleasant stay and I would defintely return again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice staff”
Reviews.Author: Hakon R
Reviews.Content: Spent four days in London to show my daughter the city, where dad worked 35 years ago. Found it very difficult to find a hotel with friendly prices and non-scaring reviews on this site. I used easytobook.com and got a price for 275 pound for four nights, which was allright - unpleasent surprice, when fees and taxes were added afterwards, sÃ¥ the total came to 330, a bit to much for my budget, but did not want to spent more time on the net searching for cheaper alternative. Location is all right, nice surroundings, short walk from Chalk Farm tubestation, Clapham and the market is nearby. The room var fine, clean, twin beds as ordered, a small TV-set, could have used a minibar/fredge to keep som juice and youghurt, since we dont eat much else for breakfast. There is free wi-fi, but only in the lobby - would not take much to have it available all over the hotel. The staff was generally very friendly and helpfull, but Alex from Rumania was the most efficient in terms of helping with a few questions on the location of a certain pub with comedy and departure times for out coach to Standstead in the early morning. Hakon, Copenhagen

Reviews.Title: “WEEKEND IN LONDON”
Reviews.Author: Mark C
Reviews.Content: Over the years I have had the good fortune to stay in some top end hotels whilst on business this hotel will never compare well with those. However for a weekend break my wife and I found it to be a clean and comfortable hotel if a little care worn and dated. Our room was on the fifth floor which afforded us a reasonable view of Hampstead. Unlike some reviews I have read on this hotel, suggesting the staff were unhelpfull I found this not to be the case. The Britannia Hotel is situated in very pleasant area of north London with only a short walk to the local tube station at Chalk Farm. My wife and I stayed for two nights whilst taking in a show and doing some site seeing. All in all a perfect weekend.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad”
Reviews.Author: paulh454
Reviews.Content: There are some pretty bad reviews of this hotel on here but I am happy to say that its OK - not great but certainly not as bad as some people like to make out. My review may be slightly tainted in that my three night stay was free as I used Tesco Clubcard vouchers to pay for it! If I had paid the Â£330 cash price I would have been very disapointed but I have seen some reasonable deals for this place. The whole place is a bit dated but the rooms are clean as is the bedding and towells we were provided with. Bathroom was fine and the shower was great. Check in was easy, from walking in the door I was in my room inside 5 mins. Breakfast is again OK - a wide selection of hot food and continental breakfast. Service from the staff is again OK, most seem to be Eastern European and don't know much about the area but they are pleasant enough. One complaint at Breakfast was that they were removing my plate as I was finishing my last mouthfull - is that great service or just too eager?!!? The hotel is a 10/15 minute walk to the nearest Tube (Chalk Farm) and you can be in central london within 15 mins from there. All in all, no problems, clean enough hotel but I would be unhappy if I had paid Â£110 a night my vouchers covered. Just dont expect the Ritz (which it doesnt preted to be) and you'll be fine.

Reviews.Title: “Weekend in London”
Reviews.Author: Susan S
Reviews.Content: very enjoyable stay, super breakfast, friendly, welcoming staff. Good location. Would definately stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Not good at all... My room had no windows!”
Reviews.Author: nlay
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Britannia Hampstead in September 2011 on a business trip. The location of the hotel is good - It's a 10 minute walk from Chalk Farm tube station and there's a variety of lovely restaurants near by. However, the hotel itself leaves a lot to be desired. Check in was a labourious process and I was almost given the keys to another guest's room. When I made it to my room it was very tired and dated, smelt damp and had NO WINDOWS! I asked if there were any other rooms (preferably with windows) available in the hotel but unfortunately there were not. The hotel was also very noisy and there was no wi-fi reception in the basement. Quite how this hotel justifies charging what they do for a damp, dark basement rooms I have no idea. Whilst the location is convenient, I certainly would not recommend this hotel particularly, if like me, you value rooms with windows.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for London”
Reviews.Author: sterwi
Reviews.Content: Hotel was alright, decor was dated, and there was a creepy portrait in the bathroom, but room was clean enough and decent. Good budget hotel for a few nights stay in London.

Reviews.Title: “Just to reassure other guests...”
Reviews.Author: stronach01
Reviews.Content: A friend & I spent 2 nights here at the beginning of September on a quick trip to London. The hotel is very basic and run down. could be good if the owners spent some money on maintenance. However the beds were comfortable, and the room etc clean; Furniture very tatty but again clean - breakfasts very good, plenty of choices and well cooked. Staff doing their best to make guests comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “OK stay.....”
Reviews.Author: JillyTPreston_Lancs
Reviews.Content: We stayed here this past weekend and having read the TA reviews, were not surprised by anything at the hotel. Turn right out of Chalk Farm tube station and right at the traffic lights - about a 10 minute walk. Check in was very easy and given with a smile. We were a little early but a quick call ensured our room was ready. I had emailed ahead and requested a room with a view and we were duly allocated room 516. The room itself was quite large by London standards and we could see the Guerkin and BT tower from our room. The carpet was stained in places and there was no air con (as previously mentioned) and the tv was an old fashioned box type as opposed to the new slim line ones.The bathroom was OK but in dire need of renovation - all the enamel was chipping away in the bath, so we just used the provided bath mat and showered instead of having a bath (which we do like to do after a long days sight seeing) We did notice that some of the rooms on the 5th floor had new carpets but not sure about new bathrooms! Our weekend break only included continental breakfast and the person checking us in for breakfast emphasised "continental breakfast only!" didnt ask if we would like to upgrade to Full English if we wanted. The continental breakfast was ok. Dishes cleared away very promptly but we didnt have table cloths for breakfast. Didnt dine here in the evenings but did have a couple of drinks in the bar - price wise very similar to neighbouring Camden. We went out in Camden both Friday and saturday evenings - absolutely buzzing place - no one seems to get dressed up though I noticed :-) and caught the number 31 bus back to the hotel getting off on Adelaide Rd before the lights. Check out was fine and yes we would stay here again but hopefully in a refurbished room next time.

Reviews.Title: “A very average hotel that could be a lot cleaner.”
Reviews.Author: ChrisMarr1
Reviews.Content: We booked our trip with super breaks so we did manage to get a really good price for our trip. That being said, the cheap rate we have received is no excuse for turning a blind eye to the dirtiness of the room we were in. Beside our bed there was a stain that looked fairly fresh; a spilled drink or something. There was also a smell of uncleanliness in the room. The bed was really bad; you could feel the springs in the matress...it felt quite cheap. The linen was also stained in places. There are also a few maintenance and upkeep issues. The staff were friendly enough, no complaints there. Nothing really stood out at all. An average hotel, probably won't come back.

Reviews.Title: “Good value”
Reviews.Author: organicprof
Reviews.Content: Every place in London is expensive, but this hotel is reasonably good value. We chose it for its proximity to Camden Market. It's actually midway between two subway stops: Camden Market and Swiss Cottage. It's about a 10 min. walk from either one; if you have a lot of luggage, you probably want to take a taxi. There's free Wifi but only in the (comfortably furnished) public lounge. Breakfast at the hotel is expensive but there's a Tesco nearby where you can buy your own food. There's also a laundromat around the corner, with a nice coffee shop next door where you can enjoy a snack while your clothes are in the washer or dryer.

Reviews.Title: “As usual great !”
Reviews.Author: phillip o
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel many times now and yes, some of the rooms are dated decor wise etc but in my opinion it is a place to stay, and if visiting london there is so much more to see and than inspecting every corner of a bedroom ! the last time I was there there seemed to be some bedroom refurbishment going on I know the 4th and 5th floors have been done and for the prices usually paid at this hotel the rooms are great and a decent size too.I was very impressed with the breakfast and there was a good choice of things available.Also the bar prices are fairly reasonable too for london and the bar will stay open as long as you want it to.too many people visit hotels to find fault, this is a great place to stay, good value and very close to central london I stay here whenever in london if I can and look forward to returning in november

Reviews.Title: “Poorest hotel I have ever stayed in”
Reviews.Author: Stevenrl
Reviews.Content: We booked an Executive double room which one would assume, albeit a 3 star hotel, would have a well sprung mattress and not shabby decor. On arrival we rejected 2 rooms offered as the mattresses were well past their sell by date. As well as shabby decor, there were niggling things such as dried blood in the base of one wardrobe, cigar butts in the slide window track, torn quilt covers,an unstable old style television on a wobbly stand, torn curtains etc. As well, there as a general lack of investment in general decor ie. paint and wallpaper were in poor state of repair in all three rooms we were offered..I called the Duty Manager who tried the poor mattress and she admitted it was useless (this was the second attempt to find a reasonable room). When asked why the mattresses are not checked, she replied that as they had 100 bedrooms and therefore there was not time to check mattresses!!! I pointed out the key element of a hotel bedroom was a decent mattress and a clean environment, neither of which this hotel seems able to achieve. We have written to the Chairman of this hotel group and the General Manager over 10 days ago, and in keeping with the poor value this hotel offers we have not had the courtesy of a reply to date. I would warn anyone to inspect the rooms on offer before allowing the hotel staff to authorize your credit card as they appear to think that the rooms are acceptable. You will have difficulty getting any sort of refund once you have authorized payment. I feel ashamed that future visitors to this hotel will judge us as a nation who put up with this poor value for money. It is not the case and I would encourage you to seek alternative accommodation and treat this hotel as a choice of last resort.

Reviews.Title: “A reasonable weekend”
Reviews.Author: CAJG2537
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I stayed 3 nights on a well known brand theatre break. We requested a quiet room and were allocated a room at the back of the hotel. The room was indeed quiet and as other reviewers have noted clean yet rather dated; our main concern was the poor ventilation and lack of air conditioning which meant a very hot room at night. The buffet breakfast food was excellent both in range and quality though the toaster seemed to require frequent adjustment. Repeated journeys to make tea and coffee were frustrating. Larger cups/mugs for the instant coffee and tea bags would be a big improvement as would tea/water/coffee pots delivered to tables! Most of the staff were helpful when approached but a litlle more proactive interaction and smiling would go a long way. Once we worked out the buses from Camden our travel was much easier and one bus change got us back to Paddington.

Reviews.Title: “We Had Great Time,”
Reviews.Author: heather g
Reviews.Content: We were horrified by the previous reviews of the hotel, and thought about rearranging due to the riots. The hotel was in a quiet area an easy tube journey from Kings Cross. The room was spotlessly clean although the furniture was dated, the beds were comfy and the rooms well equiped. The buffet breakfast was fine with a good selection and plenty of it. We ate in the hotel one night and it was average, but we were tired with sightseeing and we happy to relax. Our break was through Superbreaks and very reasonable , to have a better more central hotel would have doubled the cost. The staff were all helpful especially Dirwan at breakfast. Tip Buy and Oyster card as the journeys are cheaper and easier. Tip buy a 2 day big bus tour Â£32 and meant we could hop on and off where we liked. And hear tour guides. Tip we ate the Primrose Eaterie an easy walk from the hotel , the 3 course meal is Â£16.95 at tea time, delicious with the best pancakes ever.

Reviews.Title: “Complete Dichotemy”
Reviews.Author: JockBerks
Reviews.Content: The rating for this hotel with just a little bit of effort could have been very good/ excellent. We booked in for a Saturday and Sunday night. It was probably my fault, but they had provided a cot in the room. For a couple in their 70's it was obviously not required. The room we found to be well appointed and comfortable. However the holder for the shower head was broken, one of the lights in the bathroom was out. This made shaving and or applying makeup a bit of a problem. We almost had to resort to braille to carry out these functions. The main problem was that on the Saturday night there was a wedding reception with an exceptionally noisy disco which seemed to vibrate the full first floor where we were staying. (We were right over the disco). Bearing in mind that a cot had been provided, what was the mindset which allocated those rooms to us. At 11.40pm I phoned reception to ask how long the disco was going to continue and was told - another hour sir. That was obviously not the right answer. They volunteered to find out and ring me back. They didn't. At midnight I went down to find out what was happening and was told that it had finished. (From reception you cannot hear anything) With that I was satisfied and went back up stairs to the bedroom and found that the noise was just as bad as ever. I have to confess that I do get a bit uppity when I am told an untruth. My final effort seemed to work. The following morning we reported the light situation and were told that it would be actioned. Monday morning we again had to resort to braille. As I said earlier it could have been a very good stay, the quality was good the surroundings were excellent, but there was something wrong in attention to detail.

Reviews.Title: “We loved everything about it”
Reviews.Author: Doreen D
Reviews.Content: My daughter and i have just got back from a two night stay and couldnt fault it.Staff very friendly and extemely helpful nothing was too much trouble.Room spotless and comfortable, breakfast lots of choice and very nice, bar and lounge lovely and relaxed for a night cap.We would certainly stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, lovely staff, we'll be coming back!”
Reviews.Author: happy-traceller
Reviews.Content: We recently came back from a short stay at the Britania hotel at Hampstead, we stayed there for a couple of nights while we were in London celebrating our 25th wedding anniversary. The hotel is in an excellent location, only 3 tube stops from Kings Cross station on the Northern line. Regents park is a 5minute walk away. The staff at the hotel are lovely... our daughter had arranged for champagne, chocs and flowers to be in our room when we arrived and she said that the staff she had dealt with were very helpful, the manager had even taken the trouble to get us a card from him and the staff, thanks for that :) The breakfast is an all you can eat buffet, with full english breakfast on offer amongst a large selection of cereals, fruit, yoghurt, cheese and meats etc. We had this both mornings and didn't need to eat again till teatime! Well worth the cost! The bar prices were the cheapest that we came across... around Â£1.50 per pint cheaper than any other pub we drank in. The food prices were excellent too.. Â£2.99 for a huge burger and chips! Our room was on the 5th floor, and had a fantastic view of the city, the room itself was nice and big, and comfortable. When we come to London again, we will definately stay here. Thanks for making our 25th wedding anniversary extra special :)

Reviews.Title: “JUST THE JOB !”
Reviews.Author: POPPY196912
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel with my husband and our two teenage sons and we thought it was great ! Loveley hotel with clean rooms and nice breakfast and relaxing bar in the evening. Would not hesitate to stay here again and would recommend to a friend. Also we found the decor very quaint and tasteful .

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Clean and adequate and handy for getting into London”
Reviews.Author: jvmerlin
Reviews.Content: We were staying on a package tour and so all prepaid. The hotel was clean and staff polite, although it was not obvious that the offers advertised for meals etc did not apply to us. This was later sorted and we understood. The room was very small but clean, and lovely fluffy towels in bathroom. Definitely in need of updating, as very old and large furniture, though the bed was very comfortable. It was just very unfortunate that we stayed on some of the hottest days of the summer so far and having no air conditioning the room was very hot and humid and difficult to sleep in. We did try to move rooms but could not move for the 2 nights, only the second night. The indian buffet was very nice for dinner, and breakfast was plentiful although it would have been nice to have proper coffee to drink rather than instant coffee. In all it is a very convenient hotel to get into the West End and the shops. Chalk Farm tube station is only a few minutes away and Regent's Park and London zoo are only 10-15 minutes walk away - plenty for children to do there. It is a convenient hotel for access to London, and for it's price (it does not pretend to be 5*) it is worth considering for a stay.

Reviews.Title: “never again”
Reviews.Author: patrickduprez
Reviews.Content: this was still one of the ugliest room I ever stayed in, I was there with my girlfriend and kids, I had two rooms, our room in the basement of the children on the first floor. in the basement was not much, but still better than the kids, I think this hotel should be demolished, something like this I've never seen before. I'm sorry for the people who work there, but I recommend to anyone not to book it

Reviews.Title: “Terrible Experience”
Reviews.Author: bert1118
Reviews.Content: First day, the toilet broke. They wouldn't fix it; they woudn't give me a discount; they wouldn't move me to another room. After I made a stink, they moved me to another room for just one night expecting me to pack again & move back the next night. Feeling disguisted, I moved to another hotel. Also, after a month, I've been unable to get an itemized receipt from this hotel. The one good thing about this hotel is their breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “ignore bad reviews”
Reviews.Author: welshmother3
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 2 nights in july, room on 5th floor had a wonderful view over london. Yes the furniture is "tired and dated" but room, and bathroom were clean and tidy. with nice white towels. Didn't eat there apart from breakfast which was plentiful and very adequate so cannot comment on other meals at hotel. 7.00 pm is a bit late for anyone wanting to go to a show in central london, so we had to eat elsewhere. Would go back again as good value for money, not far from tube and bus stop just outside.

Reviews.Title: “excellent stay, good management !”
Reviews.Author: VJukbusiness
Reviews.Content: after long tiring day in London when i came back to hotel , felt happy by the hospitality , warm welcome at reception & service of staff & manager. rooms are nice & bigger as compared to the other hotel in London. hotel has a good location & view from room was beautiful. on that day i was thinking to have dinner out but changed my mind after looking good buffet dinner menu & offer was excellent. good dinner promotion by manager at the reception. nice service at the restaurant. over all i had nice & excellent stay, i would recommend this hotel to my family & friends as well . thank you Britannia...

Reviews.Title: “superb view of london skyline”
Reviews.Author: elken
Reviews.Content: we were first of all given a basement room with no windows. i asked if there was another room available and we were lucky enough to be given one on the 4th floor with a large balcony. here we were able to sit and take in the wonderful view. i loved being so close to camdon, primrose hill, and even walked to hampstead heath! we were not included for breakfast but there was a 2 for 1 offer on, although we decided to eat out as so many nice restaurants close by.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid”
Reviews.Author: Nickynackynoos
Reviews.Content: We've stayed in London a few times and have never encountered such rude, apathetic staff. Service was appalling. Despite prepaying we were asked on arrival and then again on departure to pay Â£314 for our room. Breakfast ok but staff were clearly only there to open windows when the toaster caught fire. Terrible value for money.

Reviews.Title: “do not stay here”
Reviews.Author: kizzy666
Reviews.Content: Travel and stay in London quite a bit and booked a weekend trip for my wife and myself as a birthday treat for her. we were given a basement room no bigger than a box which was so hot it made you feel unwell. I paid Â£150 for a 2 night stay with breakfast included. Staff were unbelievably rude and unhelpful. asked about ventilation for room and told nothing they could do. had problem with breakfast on first morning. booked full were told only continental. sorted. Again problems second morning with same problem. staff very rude and we were told not their problem to check with our booking agent. Staff were so rude and abrupt my wife ended up in tears!!! their response was to call security! Mananger apologised but i would not recommentd this hotel to anyone. very rude staff with NO communication skills whatsoever. Spoilt what was supposed to b a special birthday weekend.

Reviews.Title: “Imagine the worst thing you could then go one step closer to oblivion and you are still not close to this hotel.”
Reviews.Author: stupidscreennamebox
Reviews.Content: I had to stay in this hotel as i booked late for a trip and normal hotels were full. I arrived very late and was put into a smoking room. I had not requested this. It was awful, quite possibly the worst room i have ever stayed in anywhere in the world! I asked the duty manger the following morning to move me to a non smoking room. I returned to the hotel after midnight to find I had not been moved. I stood my ground and the manager agreed to move me. He then handed me the key to my old room so that I could go and get my own luggage and move it to a new room! Breakfast was another disaster. At 7am I was the only person in the dining room. I had not ordered breakfast so was not allowed to eat until I had gone and paid in advance for breakfast. This involved putting my plate back under the hot lamps until I came back from paying. Hotel is old and dated, smelly room was horrid, and staff who I interacted with were not brand ambassadors! Do not stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Quaint hotel by primerose hill great price for such a location”
Reviews.Author: onotascreenname
Reviews.Content: I was quite surprised reading the previous reviews! I had a great stay at the HAmpstead Britannia, the staff i had contact with were very helpful and pleasant (front desk). I loved the big windows in the room and the spacious rooms as well as the wooden green veranda and walking through primerose hill after breakfast. I will definately book again at this quaint hotel and have recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for group stay”
Reviews.Author: ela096
Reviews.Content: Used for a group stay for university-aged students, for one week. Accommodations were clean and comfortable. Staff was very professional and helpful. Location was in a nice part of town and a short walk to the tube. The included buffet-style breakfast had a nice selection and made for a hearty meal. Free high-speed wireless in the lobby. Overall, I am left with only good things to say about this hotel and would highly recommend for mostly any type of visitor(s) to London.

Reviews.Title: “Adequate as bed only”
Reviews.Author: darbishire
Reviews.Content: We wanted somewhere on Primrose hill, bed only and got it. Room got hot and stuffy and could not open window more than a crack - Health and Safety, bed 4'6" but ok, plenty of storage. Staff very helpful but place a bit shabby. As did not eat there cannot comment on food.

Reviews.Title: “An underground room with no windows, stiflingly hot, for Â£60 !!”
Reviews.Author: Martray41
Reviews.Content: The staff must be weary of complaints about this frankly awful hostelry! It has an expensive and awkward little sutberranean carpark, the eating arrangements in the evening are simple in the extreme. Rooms on floor -1 should be avoided at all cost! The motto of this place seems to be 'pack 'em in'; - few will ever come back but in the meantime they have been fleeced. Some may also have symptoms of food poisoning if they are driven to sample the 'warm bufffet; which seems to be the standard offering here for those unwise enough not to have made their eating arrangements before they arrived. To be fair, the breakfast was copious, but totally disorganized, as the long queue forming outside the door since 6.45 meant that it was first come, first served, with staff reduced to rushing around clearing tables. Hardly a quality experience. Is it really so easy to get 3* these days?

Reviews.Title: “Poor, but considering the price... still poor.”
Reviews.Author: CikorkaDesiato
Reviews.Content: The first exterior sight was really unwelcoming, but we said to ourselves that we are not in London because of hotels. We had the "standard, best available" room prebooked. Actually this meant that the receptionist will take us to smelly pits with numbers 019 and 020 in long forgotten section of most distant corner of their gloomy basement. Wee bedder with claustrophobic ceiling almost touching our heads and with no window. We came to the reception complaining, but the receptionist person switched that very moment ("incidentally") and the new one just nodded with dead pan that "yes, my favourite room" and offeren us with standard rooms, corresponding the price. The rest of our stay was OK as noone bothered us with any service, offers or glimpse at all. Bathrooms were not as filthy as the oubliette we were plunged into first. Maybe lucky us that the weather was sunny and warm even during nights. Next time in London I will try hard to find anything else.

Reviews.Title: “Don't go there”
Reviews.Author: MRD88
Reviews.Content: Staff on reception OK. Rooms were disgusting. 1980's wallpaper, carpets so dirty you needed to leave your shoes on, bathroom in very poor state (wood panels delaminating, over use of sealant), repairs to door frame that made no attempt to disguise the fact the door had been kicked in (?) and repairs to the bed frame using a wood filler. Bed was fairly comfortable but the feel of the sheets and covers made us wonder if they had been washed properly. Poor bar service. Waited 10 mins to get served and then when someone arrived to serve they served a queue crasher! Breakfast. They put enough out to make it look comparable to other better quality and cheaper hotels but most of the cooked items were overcooked.

Reviews.Title: “Good Break”
Reviews.Author: trussell074
Reviews.Content: All staff extremely friendly and helpful. Very good breakfast. Easy access to buses and tubes. Decor tired but room clean. Room was in basement and had no window. We were immediately offered one with a window but decided to stay put. Value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Good Budget Hotel Option”
Reviews.Author: Conquest1066
Reviews.Content: Our overnight stay with Dinner and Breakfast was very competitively priced. The hotel was basic but reasonably clean and warm. The breakfast was adequate and the Dinner provided sustainance but little more. The room was spacious even with the extra temporary bed. Furniture was a bit bashed but all worked. The mattress was however very poor. We were lucky to get a car park space. There are only about 10 in total. Because of the price paid we were happy with our stay and would consider staying again if we were looking for a budget overnight hotel

Reviews.Title: “good value for money”
Reviews.Author: richt_8
Reviews.Content: stayed here feb 21, a good 5 mins walk to chalk farm underground , the hotel reception staff polite and helpful , rooms (5th floor)nice and clean and comfy and peaceful, a nice good english breakfast , and all cereals, bar prices were ok , fosters at Â£3 a pint , we couldn't find any fault, and would recommend it to anyone, ( a nice italian restaurant round the corner

Reviews.Title: “Avoid if possible”
Reviews.Author: BlackpoolDaren
Reviews.Content: Hardly any parking spaces - the FREE parking is now chargeable and they wont honour the free parking advertised even though we had booked BEFORE the enforcement changes of 31st Jan of Â£10 per night. Staff just shrug and say it's clearly labelled - pay to park or simply dont park there. Room stunk of stale fag smoke (poor attempts to mask it with cheap air freshener had failed). One night stay is more than enough - only good bits are it's handy for Chalk Farm tubes - to link across London elsewhere (quick journey times), and the full english breakfast was nice. Rooms tired and dated, and of course the smell. Hot water was more lukewarm.

Reviews.Title: “comfortable, good location, fair for the money”
Reviews.Author: pedro3430
Reviews.Content: Having read many of the reviews I really do feel some people are being rather fussy it's not perfect and we didn't have breakfast but the one meal we had was fine. Staff were helpful and was in good location of the underground, we paid Â£112 for the weekend which is cheap for LONDON! People should get off their high horse's and realise this! Would I stop there again? Yes, but only for this price.

Reviews.Title: “EXCEEDED EXPECTATIONS”
Reviews.Author: Kericho
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a weekend at the Brittania. We had a room on the 5th floor where their superior rooms are. Great view, very comfy bed. Room clean and roomy. A little dated but no complaints. Staff were extremely helpful, quietly efficient and really friendly. Breakfast was absolutely fine except for the coffee and tea. This was the only thing that lets this hotel down badly. Given they have staff on duty waiting in the dining room, it would be a big improvement if they served tea and coffee at the table rather than provide luke warm water in thermos flasks with nes and tea bags. You have to have good coffee to satisfy people.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly helpful staff, lovely food, rooms a bit dated but very good value for money.”
Reviews.Author: JayPortsmouth
Reviews.Content: My daughter her partner and I went for a Christmas 5 day break for the second year running, we thoroughly enjoyed it. The food was lovely and plentiful, and, except for Christmas Eve the entertainment on the other nights was good. The staff were helpful and friendly and all worked very hard to make our stay enjoyable. I have to admit the rooms are a bit dated but my bed was very comfortable and the shower room was lovely and the water always hot. We all think that the break is great value for money and hopefully we will go again for the third time next year. The Hotel is so handy for walking into Camden and for the underground station to the centre of London and if you are unable to walk the No. 31 bus goes every 5 mins.

Reviews.Title: “Tired 3 star hotel”
Reviews.Author: DE62
Reviews.Content: Would estimate the hotel was built back in the 1970's and don't think much has changed. This also includes the rooms and bathroom, which are in need of an upgrade. We were, initially, met by a very miserable receptionist, however on subsequent visits other staff members were very pleasant and helpful. Breakfast was reasonable(buffet) with plenty of food aavailable. Not the best location, if travelling by train via Paddington, as the nearest tube on the Northern line is not the quickest to get to. Booked the hotel last minute, however would have preferred to have paid more and stayed in a more convenient location.

Reviews.Title: “There's nothing really 'wrong' with dated...”
Reviews.Author: gjj979
Reviews.Content: A hotel can in many ways make or break a birthday celebration in Camden Town. Having booked this one truly last minute (on the laptop sat in the hotel entrance hall), expectations were not too high, and didn't particularly need to be. The entrance hall was comfortable, and immaculate, and the staff were charming, welcoming and polite, bearing smart attire and bright smiles. Being with a friend, we booked a twin room on the second floor. The lift was spacious and swift, the corridors were clean, and the bedroom didn't disappoint. The view was not offensive, but the old aluminium windows let in a draft, and the tatty old curtains did little to defend the room from this. The bed sheets were crisp and fresh, the carpet had had a thorough vacuum, and the bathroom had plenty of towels and ablutions. The bedroom was terribly dated, but for the price (Â£79), it was plentifully up to standard. Unfortunately the bathroom shower leaked terribly, but still, it was powerful and hot. The suite was overall to a good standard. However, I would strongly advise against the Â£10.50pp breakfast, which was foul. It was overpriced, dry and poor quality, with the hash browns dripping in oil and the bacon looking like offle. It was a ten minute walk to Camden Town, and the taxi from the town cost Â£4. Overall, I enjoyed my stay at Britannia.

Reviews.Title: “Used to be OK, now completely appalling”
Reviews.Author: Lettonie
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at a few Britannia hotels over the years, and I know what to expect - iffy service and shabby, old fashioned accomodation - however, they are usually reasonably clean, well-located and good value for money. We stayed at this hotel one night in November 2010. After the inevitable slow check in, we were given a fifth floor room which was OK - we went out in Camden and got back at midnight and went to bed. At 3:30am, I was woken by a persistent knocking on the door - on going to the door and asking who was there, I was told "I am a member of staff - are you smoking in the room?" I told this person we were not smoking in the room, and were trying to sleep. He said he wanted to come into the room to check!! I rang downstairs to verify this person was a legitimate staff member, which the receptionist confirmed, then proceeded to get extremely shirty with me, saying "his system" showed we were smoking.
