Then why didn't the smoke alarm go off!? I opened the door to the man outside and told him to go away, and that I wasn't letting him into the room and that he could smell if we were smoking from the doorway. Incredibly, he tried to gain access but I shut the door. I was really angry by now. He went away. What if I had been staying alone without my partner, would he still have insisted on coming in then? Probably. I know from past experience not to bother complaining to this hotel group as they don't give a monkeys. People will always stay at Britannia Hotels because they are cheap, so what do they care? This incident left a really nasty taste in my mouth, and I would not feel happy staying there again. Dreadful.

Reviews.Title: “TERRIBLE!!!”
Reviews.Author: sarahforster2010
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a 3 day trip to London with National Holidays and this is the hotel they chose! The food is terrible, they use tinned veg instead of fresh. seating very uncomfortable to sit on while you eat your meal, so i would warn you to eat out!!! The rooms are very old looking and smell, noisy pipes and very busy road on which our room overlooked kept us awake all night, everynight. Rooms have no cooling system so they get stuffy, tried to open window with no joy, they were bolted shut!! The shower had no power at all so it took a while to rinse long hair!! The only good thing about the hotel is the location, cant complain at all about this. Please read all the other reviews about this hotel and choose a different place to stay!!!

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay here!”
Reviews.Author: Jaynedear5
Reviews.Content: Our experience of this hotel was dreadful in every way. The food was appalling (two member of our party who had the same thing fell ill after eating there), the wine was disgusting (nothing on the wine list was available), the service was very, very slow, the rooms are uninviting and the management is rude. This was supposed to be a family reunion but staying at this hotel spoilt it.

Reviews.Title: “shambolic mess”
Reviews.Author: yirmam
Reviews.Content: we went here with our university graduates, in the toilet there was a smelly dump! the receptionist said that it was only the paint departing, the food was cold, there were freaky pictures in the room, the room smelt (badly), the shower had mould on it, the beds were dusty also the room was dusty, the cleaners didn't come every day, the cleaners stole my graduates bags of dirty clothes, the rooms were smoky when you entered, the room dectorations were old and some of the wallpaper was pealing off the walls.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible”
Reviews.Author: lakedistrict26
Reviews.Content: The rooms are clean, however, the furniture and decor have not been updated in at least 30 years including the TV. The service was poor from the beginning and worst of all was the food. If you are staying at this hotel, do not eat in the hotel restaurant. I stayed one night of my stay at a premiere inn 5 minutes up the road, which was much cheaper and was far better in every way.

Reviews.Title: “Adequate and value for money”
Reviews.Author: dbarrott
Reviews.Content: I would stay here again. Rooms are good sized and clean with a comfortable bed although furniture is well worn. Bathroom is clean and well fitted. One drawback is the hot water service, this would appear to be off-peak and hence, late in the evening, the water temperature can be a little low (about 45Â° Celsius) but there is plenty of it. Towels are excellent, large, thick and absorbent. The evening meal was mediocre but there are several reasonably priced cafes and restaurants within easy walking distance. The hotel appears to be a little understaffed bur generally the staff are friendly and helpful with one exception who was probably tired at the end of a long shift.

Reviews.Title: “Good value, unpretentious hotel in a good location”
Reviews.Author: Fabcat01
Reviews.Content: Don't be put off by the unpromising exterior - or even shabby reception area. This hotel provided a spacious executive double room at only Â£85 b+b at the last minute when I was stuck. An extra Â£10 covered a reasonable supper. The room was clean and comfortable, with excellent big TV (and lots of channels) and the most fabulous view over London. I slept like a log in an enormous bed. It could do with a facelift, parking is extremely limited (it's currently a building site) and there was no real coffee for breakfast. But a good value stay close to Hampstead, Belsize Park and Chalk Farm tubes.

Reviews.Title: “Basemet Brats”
Reviews.Author: AlexanderViken
Reviews.Content: Went to this hotel with 8 friends for a nice weekend fun and soccer. When we checked in on friday evening all our rooms wa located in the basement, with no windows! After suffocating through the first night i managed to cry myself into another basement room with windows. The basement rooms are small and badly ventilated, not really fit for sleeping in. But they are cheap. I guess you get what you pay for.

Reviews.Title: “Customer Service Shocking”
Reviews.Author: AK1985UK
Reviews.Content: The hotel was of an early 90s if not 80s decor, the room was ok, but there was just no care into it, old school TV, bathroom, furniture etc. The staff were pretty bad, we had a small bald headed guy with glasses serving at the bar with no personality at all - and was quite rude when we ordered a drink on our first night, then the night after another guy at the bar who I was trying to order a drink from said that I would have to wait 15 minutes as he was on his break, why was he behind the bar? Overall - I was very unhappy with the customer service, just rude people!

Reviews.Title: “Liked the place and the hotel”
Reviews.Author: Skygirl81
Reviews.Content: Hampstead is a nice place to stay in London and I enjoyed my stay at this hotel. Hotel is a good three star and the area is full of nice small restaurants. My rate included continental breakfast which was OK. My room was facing the street but I had no problems sleeping as the insulation was good. As a girl travelling alone I felt safer in this area than in most in London. Will certainly be back here one day.

Reviews.Title: “Customers are really too much bother”
Reviews.Author: JimKManchester
Reviews.Content: Rooms at this hotel are not avaliable till 2pm, no exceptions! if booking you need to be aware of that. Our experience was that there was no point in trying to negotiate with the disinterested receptionist (computer says no!), despite telling her i had to get changed for a business meeting. When booking this hotel make sure you know what room they intend to place you in, avoid 1-16. We were placed in a windowless dungeon (no 16) in the basement, which was sweltering and with no air con. On booking out we had to put up with much sighing, huffing and puffing when we asked if we cound leave our cases for a couple of hours. This increased when a new customer came into the reception, clearly he was just too much effort. Good points were location, very handy for Camden, Swiss Cottage, Regents Park etc. Clean, room was a good size, and coould not fault the cleanliness.

Reviews.Title: “Prisoner Cell Block H”
Reviews.Author: mrsnutLancashire
Reviews.Content: i stayed at this hotel last year for business purposes and found it ok. This time round is was not good!! we stayed for two nights and although the location was good for where we wanted to visit (camden and kentish town) thats about the only positive i have! We were placed in what can only be described as a prison cell in the basement. no window, no air conditioning and NO AIR!!! after being told that there was no other rooms available we had to settle for a little desk fan to stop us from suffocation. The staff were uninterested and rude. i didnt bother with breakfast, theres plenty of cafes around at half the cost. i wont be staying here again and i wont be recommending to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “You'll recognise the Breakfast Chef - He's the one with the Tin Opener!”
Reviews.Author: QuoVadisWeymouth
Reviews.Content: This hotel is set in the leafy suburbs of Hampstead which is a quite pleasant area of London. The hotel (fortunately) has no control over the location and things go downhill from there. I arrived mid evening after a long journey. The room had been prebooked by my company. Unfortunately I had only just read the reviews before leaving home and hoped they were wrong. I was given the key to room number 1 which I advised was in the basement. I went to the room and found there was no window, no air conditioning and no extractor fan in the toilet/bathroom. I immediately returned to the reception and was told there were no other rooms. I pointed out that the room I had been shown was not highlighted on the website where there is talk of balconies, trouser presses and other missing amenities in the 'concrete cell'. The girl replied instantly with a 'We have no control over our website' mantra that I think had been trotted out many times before. If I had booked privately I would have walked out at that point but my accomodation had been arranged for the purpose of work and I was in an area of London I did not know. Therefore I switched to the 'make a scene in the lobby' strategy which I find often works. Suddenly Room number 18 became free. This was still in 'the dungeon' but at least had a window. The window was about 6 feet from the road and situated on a level with exhaust pipes of a busy road with lots of stationary traffic due to road works. Smelly and noisey! The curtains were designed to be closed with a pulley (missing) and finished about two inches above the window ledge. Handy by a public road. Apart from the traffic fumes and road noise the room was OK although there was still no air conditioning or toilet extractor (smelly for non traffic reasons!). There is no wi-fi available. I was booked in for breakfast. There were tinned mushrooms, tinned tomatoes, tinned peaches, tinned apricots and tinned fruit salad. A real tribute to the canning industry. You could have your eggs in any way you wished as long as they were scrambled. From the even texture, colour and watery surround I suspect they may have been powdered. On the second morning they were crowned with a scattering of parsley (not tinned!). The sausages were a cheap catering variety with a pinkish grey sludge in the centre that was probably suitable for vegetarians and surrounded with collagen skins. There was a tray each of ham, salami and cheese on the first morning. The quantities diminished day by day and they were not even re-arranged to fill the gaps. By day three the ham and cheese looked a little sorry and the salami did not even put in an appearance (lost the tin opener?!?). On the last morning the breafast room was 10 minutes late opening and the waiter was stressed. It was a little unnerving to see him ripping open the sliced bread wrappers and fondling each slice with his uncovered hands as he arranged them by the toaster. There did not appear to be many private travellers around but there were a number of teams of workers staying at the hotel who, from their vans and clothing, were in the civil engineering and associated fields. Yeoman stock all but you do get a good grounding in some basic Anglo-Saxon expletives! All in all an unsatisfactory experience that my company paid well in excess of a Â£100 per night for. If you do decide to ignore this review (and many similar ones for the same establishment) then I suggest you at least insist you are not given rooms 1-18 in 'the dungeon'. But there again some people may be into that sort of environment - bring your own chains!

Reviews.Title: “DRAWER FULL OF TOENAIL CLIPPINGS”
Reviews.Author: KimberleyCadger
Reviews.Content: We arrived to find the reception looking okay. The staff were not great providing adequate service. when I arrived at my room, I found the room to be old, outdated and smelling of damp. there was mould around the windows and taps, the beds were uncomfortable, and was horrified to find that when I opened the drawer beside the bed, it was full of TOENAIL CLIPPINGS. When reported to the staff they had someone go and clean the drawer immediately and they were disgusted to hear about it. I was shocked that this would even happen. The breakfast was not greatly enjoyed and I would not recommend this hotel to anyone!

Reviews.Title: “Not the best, but not the worst!”
Reviews.Author: TJS1006
Reviews.Content: We'd read some of the reviews and were a bit apprehensive about this hotel. When we arrived the staff were very polite and helpful. We had a triple room but it looked as though this was an ordinary twin room with another bed squeezed in. The beds however were very clean and comfortable. The hotel itself is fairly dated, but for all the time you spend in it it was absolutely fine. There was a decent choice for breakfast. Main reservation about the hotel was its location which was about a 10 minute walk (up a wee bit of a hill) from Chalk Farm Tube Station, we'd previously stayed in Russell Square which is much more central and seems a nicer area. All in all the hotel was fine and other than it's location we would have no problems going back.

Reviews.Title: “Good value but staff need to be more helpfull”
Reviews.Author: MORGANLLANELLI
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Hotel for 2 nights with my family ok location about 10mins walk from Chalk Farm tube station on the Northern Line. When wea arrived around 1.00 we had to wait for our room so asked about what was near so we could go for a walk but it was too much trouble for the women (late 30s ish no name tag) to tell us anything she was more interested in looking into her screen and wanting to pass me onto someone else and then she kept butting in and being negative when the other member of staff tried to help then when the phone rung she kept looking around and tutting as if to suggest it was not her job !!! I would say she has been there for a long time and feels she does everything!! Breakfast was ok but tea and coffee was always cold as they were kept in flasks and even when new ones came out were still cold. It was a help your self buffet but on both days even though we ate at peak time 8.30 there was always something missing and was the same excuse ON ITS WAY but never turned up. All in all been to better hotels but it suited us as we were not in the hotel for long

Reviews.Title: “Tired but ok”
Reviews.Author: Mootman
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel for 3 nights. The cost was similar to Crewe Hall hotel (Crewe) where we stayed a week earlier, and had a fantastic experience. The hotel does not compare favourably with the service and other features. Parking was severly limited, and we only just managed to find a parking place after panicking we wouldn't be able to park due to local permit only parking restrictions. Having booked the hotel because it said parking was available I was upset about availability. The hotel could have been cleaner and the decor was tired. Traffic noise was constant, but we were staying in London after all. Despite the above, the stay seemed to have cured my terrible insomnia and I had a good night's sleep. Perhaps search elsewhere, and use as a last resort.

Reviews.Title: “this hotel is a hell hole”
Reviews.Author: silvo28
Reviews.Content: on arriving at this hotel we was shocked to see how run down it was when we went to our rooms they where dirty they had urine stains on the sheets, carpets was covered with some sort of powder to stop insects, holes in the walls. going down for evening meal it just was awful the lamb onn that night caused several people to be ill, behind where the food was served was mouse bait traps but also the cereals from the morning all over the floor. the hot plate where food was served was still dirty at 12.30 on the night. this hotel is a health hazard. staff are very rude and most unable to speak to english.

Reviews.Title: “One of the worst hotels I've ever stayed in”
Reviews.Author: Paula99Leeds
Reviews.Content: I feel really bad about writing this review, however YOU need to know about my stay at Brittania Hampstead! I'll start by explaining that I'm a veteran business traveller and have stayed in many hotels in the UK and Europe. I am currently employed by a company with a head office near Hampstead so I stay in the area approx once a month. I usually stay at the Premier Inn, however, it was fully booked and so my colleague put me in the Brittania for two nights instead. Briefly, the hotel is in need of major, full refurbishment. There were gaps around the rotten window frames in my room. The decor was very poor (both in taste and condition) and there were stains on the furnishings and carpets. One of the two lifts broke down shortly after I arrived and so this led to long waits for the working lift. On night one, I was on the 3rd floor, I think. (As soon as I saw the room I complained and tried to change it but they were full) The noise levels there are unbearable due to sound reflecting off the block of flats opposite. I had to sleep with the windows open due to the excessive heat (there was no air conditioning and it was so hot that I had to sleep naked!). I got no sleep as it was very noisy outside - street cleaners, ambulances and fire engines - not to mention the normal traffic noise. Oh, and the bus stop outside just adds to the engine noise! In the morning I complained and insisted on a different room for the 2nd night. I was given one near the end of the top floor. These rooms were of a better standard than the lower floors, but even this standard was the bare minimum of what I would have expected. Again, it was terribly hot and I had to sleep with the windows open, but the room was much less noisy than the previous one. TIP - you must request a room that is NOT opposite the large block of flats, this will be quieter. Also, there are no nets at the hotel windows so the flats just look into the hotel rooms! Parking - the car park is ridiculously small and takes approx 8 cars. Some spaces are taken by staff. The on street parking is not available until 6.30pm, so if you arrive when the car park is full there is nowhere to park until the restrictions are lifted at 6.30pm. I got there around 5pm both days - on day 1 I had to haggle with a builder who was trying to get the last parking space - I won!! On day 2 I got the last space. Fortunately, my manager came up to my hotel room when I booked in and so she saw how bad it was - or else I wouldn't have expected anyone to believe me! We now reschedule company meetings if the Premier is full, rather than expect me to stay in the Brittania.

Reviews.Title: “WOULD HAVE BEEN OK IF WE HAD NOT BEEN IN THEBASEMENT”
Reviews.Author: Ted1037
Reviews.Content: The room was large and comfortable with a good bathroom, the only problem was it was in the basement in the far corner of the building. We feel that it was because of this our room was broken into and we we had camera, credit cards and money stolen. Police thought it was done by a previous employee with a duplicate key.We were only out of the room for an hour so someone must have been watching. If you stay insist on a room above thr third floor. We had to drag our bagsthrough numerous fire doors, fortunately there was a lift down. The restraunt was ok and the food a reasonable price but a limiited menu, there was only one public internet access but it is close to pubs, shops, laundrymat etc. While we were there the front drive was blocked every day by Builders vehicles making it very difficult for taxis and hire cars to stop outside. The enterance is by a revolving door which makes it very difficult to get your bags in and out. The outside area was dirty with lots of litter making the entrance very unatractive, someone with broom could have made a big difference. We feel that with a bit more care and attention from management and staff the place could be improved, right now we could not recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “dont go for a romantic weekend”
Reviews.Author: graeme1974
Reviews.Content: Went to see a show as a surprise for my husbands birthday. Were booked into a basement room that had no window so was too hot and claustrophobic. Got moved to executive room and that was a joke. Curtains didn't fit, 4 inch gap at the bottom, hanging off at the top. Enamel coming off the bath, taps and shower dirty and mouldy, covered in limescale. Sockets not working. Tv burst at the side. If you want to eat find somewhere outside as the all you can eat buffet dinner is shocking. This hotel is definitly not worth the money. Staff not very helpful either.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth its 3 star rating”
Reviews.Author: aberdeen1903
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel on Friday and Saturday 30/31 July 2010 at the end of our holiday, we had previously spent 10 days in Washington DC and were looking forward to spending the last couple of nights in a nice London hotel. Overall the room and bathroom were clean but I hated being in a basement room the lack of a window or natural light was awful. On arrival the receptionist was very helpful (we were really early) she took our luggage and locked it away for us, but on our return we were faced by a totally different person who was snippy and rude to everyone. After a hot night we were anxious to get breakfast and leave for the day, on our return we were subjected to the receptionist having a heated debate with another guest, on return to our room we found that a floor fan had been left for us, this was a blessed relief as a I didn't know how I was going to sleep another night in 'the cave'. After breakfast, (which was okay) my husband asked the receptionist to book a taxi for us, when we checked out he asked her if it was black cab or a minicab she then went onto say we NEVER phone black cabs and you asked for a taxi at 11am, its only 10.30, he was only asking what type of taxi was picking us up, then she barked, take a seat or wait outside! We were glad to leave, the experience overall was not good at the end of our holiday, To be honest we were to tired to argue the point with the staff, the basement room was not what I would have expected but to be fair when you looked up the building from street level it doesn't look as if those rooms are better and reading the reviews they seem to be worse. The other thing was that there was a wedding on at the hotel on the Saturday night and as our room was below the reception area it sounded like there was a stampeding heard of elephants above us. If you do stay in this area check out the Belgo restaurant and bar, it is great.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and value for money”
Reviews.Author: tatchie
Reviews.Content: Arrived on 27th July 2010. Myself, husband and 6 year old. Bit apprehensive after reading earlier reviews but apart from the Receptionist on arrival not being very welcoming, the rest of the staff were very friendly and did there best to accomodate all requests. We would definately stay there again. And it is very handy for transport/tube links.

Reviews.Title: “Seen better days”
Reviews.Author: frankmol62
Reviews.Content: This hotel has four things going for it,its location in Primrose Hill,free client car parking,C11 bus stops right outside,our stay was free via Tesco Clubcard.We stayed on rhe fourth floor,our bedroom furniture was chipped and stained,there were tiles missing in the bathroom,we had to walk around the floor standing TV,a dismal room.Breakfast was part of the deal,this was also poor with sausages,eggs and bacon deteriorating under the buffet heat lamps.

Reviews.Title: “Much Better than expected!!!!”
Reviews.Author: jj22Scotland
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from the Britannia Hampstead Hotel and we were really surprised after reading most the reviews.. Checkin was easy and we were given a double room on the 5th floor. The room was large with a double bed and a sofa., decor,carpets and bedding clean and fresh.. We did not eat in the hotel as we were room only.. Checkout was at 11 but the hotel staff are happy to keep luggage behind reception if you have a late flight/train. We could not fault this hotel and will return next year. Chalk Farm tube is approx 10 mins walk from hotel but if you prefer not to walk a number 31 bus will take you.

Reviews.Title: “Don't go with high expectations!”
Reviews.Author: yazi
Reviews.Content: The room was very hot and stuffy and had not been cleaned very well (previous occupants rubbish bag was behind the chair,), we couldn't use the hairdryer as the cord is drilled through the drawer and would not reach to the mirror. Only ate one days breakfast as we couldn't face it again, it was poor. The location was pretty good. We expected better from this hotel chain.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely terrible”
Reviews.Author: Moondoggie75
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel about a year ago. I found the staff rude, the rooms in need of decoration, shabby and barely clean. I couldn't sleep as the Walls were so thin I felt I was in bed with the couple making out next door. The food for dinner was cold and inedible. I would never recommend anyone to stay here.

Reviews.Title: “an experience”
Reviews.Author: cosyNorthDevon
Reviews.Content: chalk farm tube is not as near as you think to the hotel lugging cases up hill is not funny get a taxi !!! Room was like an oven window only opened about 8" no bedside lamps or air conditioning not sure if you had to pay for it . The hair dryer the plastic had melted on the outside of the casing and you had to be on your knees to use it as the cable was thread thru a drawer which was too short ugh . breakfast nothing to write home about plastic eggs ect On the good side hotel room at the back fantastic view over London very nice staff rooms were clean would i stay there again no not enough attention to detail even for a three star

Reviews.Title: “the location was good.”
Reviews.Author: retired26
Reviews.Content: My Brother and I had 2 nights in this hotel. It was good for it's location and you get what you pay for but the breakfasts ( full continental were stale and definitely not full!) were not up to par. Our rooms were very hot (the windows did not open wide enough) and they gave me a large fan, which was on all through the 2 nights!! My brother had requested a 'quiet' room but was given one on the main road side and his television remote did not work. My bathroom had black mould around the bath edge and parts missing from the shower. The toilet was not clean (round the bend!) and the wallpaper hung from the wall in one area. The maintenance man was very good (brother's television was fixed quickly) and we had to endure a wedding party's loud music until nearly 1 oclock on the last evening - was told this was part of the contract with the wedding people but what about the guests rights. Would not go there again I think.

Reviews.Title: “The hotel that time forgot!”
Reviews.Author: cairin
Reviews.Content: First impressions of this hotel, from it's main entrance into the reception area, it appeared out dated, dark and gloomy. However, the girl on reception was most friendly and although we had arrived almost two hours before the set check-in time we were promptly given our room key and directed to the room. The room was on the second floor and was an adequate size for a double room. Although we had specified a non-smoking room on our booking, the room smelled of stale smoke. The bathroom was slightly musty and while clean could have been doing with a good old fashioned scrub with the use of some elbow grease!! The wardrobes were dusty and the window - framing the not so beautiful view of the back of a neighboring block of flats - was filthy... Also, the window, of the old fashioned sliding variety, was jammed open and refused to close! (more on this later....!) Having unpacked we went downstairs for a spot of lunch in the bar. The menu was limited and after a lengthy wait I set off in search of someone to take our order... Finally an unfriendly lady in a suit appeared and I was barked at as I placed the order, only to be told that all the ingredients for what I had ordered were not available. Having waited a considerable time she finally re-emerged from the kitchen and almost threw the plates in front of us. The food itself was not great. A trend which was followed with breakfast the following morning. Having spend the day touring London, which the hotel was conveniently located for, we returned to the hotel tired that night. The room was stuffy in the warm June heat, but even with the heat I again attempted to close the window slightly to prevent all sorts of night-time creatures from joining us in the room. However, this was to no avail as the window would not budge. With the window still open we closed the curtains and settled in for the night - only to be awoken at 5.30am by a family of pigeons balancing themselves on our window sill. A most unpleasant awaking!! On entering the dining room for breakfast, we were greeted by a most unpleasant young man, who told us to hurry up as breakfast was finishing in ten minutes. This at 9.45am when breakfast was to be available until 10am and indeed at 9.55am the kitchen staff promptly arrived and started to remove the platters from the serving area. The food itself was again poor, the selection very limited and the tea/coffee cold - we did not return for breakfast the following morning! As we were leaving the hotel for the day we asked the receptionist (a different girl from our friendly girl the previous day) to ring a taxi for us. She did so however the taxi company contracted to the hotel could not get us to our destination, which turned out to only 5 minutes walk away.... All in all the hotel provided an adequate base for our short visit to London, however it is out dated and in need of both an overhaul of the decor and of the unfriendly staff. I would not recommend this hotel and will not be returning.

Reviews.Title: “Dated and dirty”
Reviews.Author: MrKnow1
Reviews.Content: First impression of the hotel Fowey on entrance was that I was walking into the hotel that time forgot. On entering my small, stuffy room, it was apparent that not only had time forgotten the hotel, but so had the cleaners! The carpets were stained, the wallpaper peeling and looking grungy. There were two separate "rooms" for the toilet with wash basin and shower (if you could call it that). The shower was rather dirty and grimy....needed a good blast from Cellit Bang! The room was fairly small, just about manageable. The walls were paper thin. For most of the night I could hear next door's television blasting! I think the worst part of the hotel was that it reeked of stale cigarette smoke! As if that when the smoking ban was implemented, they hadn't bothered to steam clean the carpets or use air fresheners to remove the horrid stench! The location is pretty poor as there arenâ€™t many restaurants nearby and itâ€™s a fair trek to the tube station (Chalk Farm I believe). Bearing all that in mind, it is still relatively cheap (Â£220 for 4 nights) compared to most hotels in the same area.....just don't be expected wonders!

Reviews.Title: “Dirty!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: MrsWil
Reviews.Content: The room was filthy. Wall paper was peeling fom the walls. The carpets and bed linen were stained and the windows were so dirty it was difficult to see through them. The ensuite bath room was smelly and dirty. It was that bad we refused to stay in the hotel and was transferred to the National Imperial Hotel in Russell Square which is very clean.

Reviews.Title: “Rooms stuffy and dated.”
Reviews.Author: EnergyBelfast
Reviews.Content: It was 25 degrees in London, and the window was limited to opening a couple of inches - the room was like a sauna. Hotel is in a great location, but is dated and the breakfast is poor. Its okk for a night or maybe too at max - needs updating.

Reviews.Title: “good value, nice area zone 2, clean room”
Reviews.Author: skjdas
Reviews.Content: nice bed with flat tv. bathroom good size and worked well. no window in the room as it was in the basement. but at the price with free parking it was the cheapest hotel of a good standard. perfect if you are just goint to use the room to sleep and as a base.

Reviews.Title: “If you like original features in your bed room, you will love this !”
Reviews.Author: Badgernorwich
Reviews.Content: Original carpets and curtains which look circa 1980's, dirty, stained and discusting. The furniture was dusty, the chairs looked as if someones incontinent aunty had sat on them. The bathroom was crudy and not very clean. The only positive thing about the room was the bedding was clean. My sons university accommodation is better than this!!!. The staff were friendly and helpful The social areas were satisfactory if looking a little tired. The breakfast was satisfactory. We stayed in this hotel for a short holiday break - the distance to the underground was quite a walk.

Reviews.Title: “Neglected and in need of TLC”
Reviews.Author: purpleygirl
Reviews.Content: We stayed one night at this hotel and were very disappointed. The room was ok and had a nice shower and bed but the decor was badly in need of updating and the desk drawer was literally falling apart. Both the leather sofas in the lounge area were badly damaged with the stuffing spilling out of the seat pads. The wicker tub seats by the door to the terrace were in a bad condition with dirty seat pad covers. The wall by where I had breakfast had plaster missing and the dining room chair cover was dirty and stained. The manager (I took her to be the manager as she was instructing the receptionist) was very frosty. We had dinner on arrival which was a buttet style. The meat had been left out ready sliced and was dry and curling up. On the plus side the receptionist was very helpful and the restaurant staff were lovely - very helpful and friendly and couldn't do enough for you. I was really quite shocked at the condition of the hotel , it is very shabby I would definitely not recommend the hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “not even student standard!”
Reviews.Author: PandaTime
Reviews.Content: i stayed at the Britannia Hampstead hotel in march 2010 as part of a college residential trip, we were in London visiting the theatres and as this hotel was close to the underground station it seemed convenient to stay here for less money as oppose to the ridiculous city centre prices. i wish i'd stayed in the centre. when we first arrived at the hotel we were rudely treated and told to sign for our rooms, when going into the room we noticed a horrible damp smell that didnt seem to cease in the 3 days that we were there. also there were chunks missing out of the wall and the windows were impossible to see through. the ceiling of the bathroom had black mould growing above the shower and the wallpaper made my head want to burst! also the towels that were provided were not changed since the previous guest as there was blood on them. the staff at the hotel treated us rudely and unfairly, for example the bar staff were very rude and treated us as though we were an inconvenience to them for using services that they provide! all in all i would never recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “lovely”
Reviews.Author: StokeOnTrentSmiley
Reviews.Content: we read the reviews on here n i was quiet worried but we arrived at the hotel n it was really nice nt he staff were very friendly. It was our first stay in london so we askt the staff what places were local n they were realy helpful and even give us maps n tube maps and give us directions. The hotel woz quiet maybe because it was a thursday, the room was very clean and nicely decorated. breakfast was nice, overall i would stay again and we are planning to agen in a couple of months.

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable and pleasant hotel”
Reviews.Author: MickStubbles
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 4 nights - Room 505 on the Plaza Floor! Spacious room, comfortable bed. Some car parking available (also easy enough to find on street parking overnight). Food was okay if not very exciting. We arrived about 8 pm on our first night and ate in - not much left on the buffet but I suppose we were quite late. Breakfasts okay if nothing special. After booking we read some of the negative reviews; and having stayed at the Britannia it is difficult to believe that the critics were at the same hotel as we were; as I would be happy to return there in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value for money”
Reviews.Author: Solomonbrown
Reviews.Content: Stayed 2 nights bed and breakfast. Twin rooms on the first floor were large, clean and nicely furnished. Breakfast was excellent with the highest quality bacon and trimmings. All in all a hotel that more than justifies its 3 star rating and I recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “This has got to be the worst hotel we've stayed in - ever.”
Reviews.Author: slou13
Reviews.Content: We have just come back from a superbreak theatre trip in London and were unfortunate enough to choose this hotel to stay in. Never posted a review before but have been so appalled by the state of this hotel just wanted to warn other travellers. First impressions were not good- the windows were filthy and the sign outside tatty. Our room was desperate. Situated on the fifth floor, its decore was old fashioned and sparse and the walls and ceilings displayed damp patches and dirty marks. The bathroom was dirty and the shower fittings hadn't been cleaned for god knows how long and had gunge oozing from them. The kettle provided for the tea and coffee facilities had black bits floating in the bottom which were coming off the rusty/burnt element so didn't both to make a drink. The radiators didn't work at night and the room was cold. When this was reported to reception the response was that we couldn't be moved because hotel was full and they didn't have spare heaters but we could have a bottle of wine if we wished to help keep out the cold. We declined their offer as didn't see how this would help our seven year old son! The food provided in the evening was not nice at all. A hot buffet style, the meat was kept warm on hotplates and was dried and curled up. The only saving grace this hotel had was that the reception staff were helpful and the breakfast was edible and satisfactory. If we hadn't already booked and paid for it through Superbreak we would have turned round straight away and found alternative accomodation.

Reviews.Title: “Would deffinately recommend- fantastic value for money”
Reviews.Author: lisast_21
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel as it was a great deal and i wanted to take a friend to london for his birthday. I was very anxious as there were some bad reviews but booked it regardless. I must say it was the right decision as this hotel had so many good features- much more than the small unimportant features that pernickety people had pointed out. On arrival at the hotel we were extremely concerned as the outside was very dated with large windows which made it look like a hospital. However, on entering the building there was a welcoming reception, a pleasant bar and a nice looking breakfast room. As we arrived at 8am and check in wasn't until 2pm the hotel staff allowed us to leave our luggage- Free of charge! They were extremely helpful and friendly throughout our stay- i cannot stress this enough. My friend and I didn't want to book tickets for the theater from home as icy conditions made us unsure of whether we would even make it to london. Anyway, we booked tickets in london and the hotel were more than happy to print off our reservation- free of charge. After checking out, the hotel staff let us leave our stuff again. They then let us into the luggage room, go and change in the toilets, put stuff back in the room and leave for a night out before returning again to pick up outr luggage and leave for our bus. They were fine when we left our bags from 12pm-10:30pm! They were always wishing us a good day/night and really made our visit pleasant- especially when the majority of people that we encountered in London were rude, patronising and obnoxious! So i'll sum up points about the hotel that i found to be true (rather than writing an essay on each point! haha): - It is rather dated with flowery wall paper but it is spotlessly clean with maid service daily. - When i was there refurbishment work was starting- beginning on the 4th floor so soon the hotel should be completely rennovated- after that i have no idea what people could complain about! - clean towels daily - Less than a 10 minute walk from chalk farm underground and extremely easy to find - Neighbourhood is a quiet town- but felt extremely safe walking home. - Amazingly helpful staff - full english breakfast, continental food also available. I would suggest arriving for breakfast earlier though as stuff was there and still hot at 9:45/10pm but selection wasn't as big (understandable) - Fully functioning lifts - television with freeview, ensuite bathroom, tea and coffee facilities. - only ever had to change once on the underground. so basicly its (at the most) 2 subways away from madame tussades, london dungeons, victoria, kings cross, oxford street, london bridge, piccadilly circus etc. - It is in zone 2 so it is cheap to reach via the underground. A daily zone 1 and zone 2 ticket costs between Â£5 and Â£7 depending on the time of day and most if not all attractions are in these zones. We never travelled out of zone 11 and 2 and went to the london eye, big ben, the aquarium, london dungeons, madame tussauds, oxford street, piccadilly circus, london bridge, westminster abbey etc. Basicly it is a cheap, extremely clean hotel which is extremely close to everything you would want in london.

Reviews.Title: “Could do better”
Reviews.Author: Hector1
Reviews.Content: Thankfully only stayed for a couple of nights. This hotel is in dire need of some love and attention. Our room was okay, basic and a bit dated. The bed was awful, most uncomfortable, as my poor back can still testify. Breakfast was poor, everything was there, but sad versions, eg. tinned fruit, tinned mushrooms, etc. I was wary when we arrived and they took payment straight away. The receptionist was polite enough, but she seemed to me like a lady used to fending off complaints. There was a man in reception at the time demanding the number for head office, so I expect she had given him short shift. The only good thing I can say is that we did get a very reasonable rate on the room, and it was quite convenient for the tube, to get the Northern line straight into the West End. We shall not be returning, and I would not recommend.

Reviews.Title: “VERY POOR”
Reviews.Author: bamk1314
Reviews.Content: We Stayed at the Britannia, for two nights, as part of a deal with Thomas Cook, which included rail travel, the location was fine, however, the hotel was poor looking and much in need of a re vamp. We were in a basement room, with no windows, which must be like Hell in the summer as we were very uncomfortable with the heat, and yes we put the central heating off. When we came in at night and asked for a night cap, the Porter, who was on the reception desk as well, took a considerable time to appear and when he did, had no 'float' therefore had no change to give us when we paid for the drinks. The second night, the queue at the bar was not long but the service was again so slow that we gave up. Location was fine, 5 - 10 minute walk from the subway... Decore was very poor, the deal with Thomas Cook was very reasonable, the trip to London was excellent, but upgrade to a better hotel if you can.

Reviews.Title: “Well located no frills hotel”
Reviews.Author: chrissiekite
Reviews.Content: As other reviewers have said this is an hotel in need of some urgent updating, (certainly rooms 303 and 305). In its favour the staff were friendly and helpful, breakfasts plentiful, showers great with plenty of hot water. The location is very good, close to underground at Chalk Farm and walking distance to Camden Lock Market. (Not to be missed). Be prepared for rooms to be noisey. We were facing the main road and windows are not double glazed.

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: FifeFuschia
Reviews.Content: Just returned from staying 2 nights here. room on the lower floor didn't have a window but couldn't be faulted. Looked like it had been recently renovated and was spotlessly clean. Breakfast good and used Buffet evening meal which was good value at Â£10 per head. Good location for central London 3 tube stops and 10 mins walk away. Good value for money

Reviews.Title: “A reasonable hotel”
Reviews.Author: woodboroughgirl
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Britannia Hampstead for 2 nights as part of a London Theatre Break, Good location. 20 mins on the tube direct from theatre land. Good buiffet breakfast and a good sized clean room.

Reviews.Title: “A little dated but clean and accommodating”
Reviews.Author: RBBucks
Reviews.Content: I booked 7 rooms for 5 nights when we were working at Regents Park, the rooms were comfortable but a bit full of flowered wallpaper and chandeliers. The staff were friendly and welcoming if a little slow at times. The lifts are a bit scary though it feels like they have broken. An upgrade would vastly improve this establishment, however, you get what you pay for and we were very pleasantly surprised. The parking is a bit of a nightmare, get there early and be prepared to move cars around. There is plenty of parking nearby though if you are getting up early. The pubs and restaurants nearby are great. All in all a good bargain! The bar stayed open until we left which wasn't that late.

Reviews.Title: “Cleanlines is NOT their strong point”
Reviews.Author: BESTYLEGS
Reviews.Content: Just returned from The Brittania Hotel and the hotel was not impressive. We were given two rooms the an interconnecting door. We opened the door and could smell stale urine. There was still urine in the toilet from the previous guests. The I had a trple room for myself and two daughters. It was a twin room with an extra bed squeezed in. Hardly any room to move and it was a bedstead with a 2 inch mattress on top. So not very comfortable. All in all the hotel was NOT clean and I would not go back there.

Reviews.Title: “excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: stalibos
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from this hotel after spending one night here. The staff were really helpful, polite, couldnt fault them. The hotel itself was spotless. We asked for a quiet, non smoking room and that was exactly what we got. Room was very clean and tidy. Breakfast was buffet style and had everything inc full english, croissants, every kind of fruit juice and endless tea and coffee. Would definately stay here again, excellent, excellent.

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: gunniminor
Reviews.Content: The room was average, the food was ok. But the location was only the best thing about it.

Reviews.Title: “do not in any circumstances stay here - NIGHTMARE!!”
Reviews.Author: MilesBiv
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel because of the proximity to Camden Roundhouse as we went to a gig and wanted to be able to stroll in after a few drinks etc. We were given a room with no window - not even a fake one. It is a very strange experience waking up with no outside light, not one that I am eager to try again. The receptionist was rude and unhelpful. Worst of all, they have charged me twice for my stay of 1 night, they are now refusing to accept that they have charged twice - even when I have emailed them a copy of my bank statement detailing the second transaction. Arguments are ongoing Stay here, if your not fussed about such things as natural light, customer service, cleanliness, oh - and theft! I have no idea how this hotel is rated as three stars. I've stayed in nicer hostels. Fact.

Reviews.Title: “this hotel is bad”
Reviews.Author: randagioItaliano
Reviews.Content: I have been a guest of the Hampstead Britannia between the 28th of August and the 02nd of September 2009 and I can say that the only good thing about this hotel is the position: close to Primrose Hill/Regent's Park, 20 mins walk from Camden, 10 mins walk from Swiss Cottage and the Hampstead Theathre......all the rest is bad! The hotel needs an urgent refurbishment, the carpets are filthy and the rooms are poorly equiped. I was in room 513 and this didn't have not even a drawer therefore we had to leave our clothes on a table. The curtains were dusty and full of holes. One of the two elevators was out of order and we had to use the stairs as the hotel was busy and the wait would have been 10 minutes. The room service was bad (perhaps they were short in staff) and our room was only partially serviced (no hoovering, no bed make up). The rates are reasonable but I would only go back once a major refurbishment has been done.

Reviews.Title: “GOOD VALUE FAIRLY CENTRAL HOTEL WOULD RECOMMEND FOR WEST END”
Reviews.Author: grayo_9
Reviews.Content: Good value for money, this hotel is close to several tube stations and only a few stops from the West End. We had a basement room which did smell a bit damp and had no windows but was otherwise ok. Was some cleaning noise going on fairly early on a Sunday morning at around 8am, but would not put me off staying again! Continental breakfast was quoted in the price, but turned out to be full English plus all the usual buffet fare, so highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “A Mediocre experience - this review sums everything up.”
Reviews.Author: JammyDodger26
Reviews.Content: Well, a few friends and I stayed at this hotel for a night on our trip to london. When we arrived, we were greeted nicely by a lady who insisted we called her "granny" because her name was grenola or something similar. The rooms are quite compact, though plentiful. The TV was good; nothing wrong with that but the rooms were quite dated and the lack of a balcony to open a wide window or two made the room stifling hot in march! The showers were good, as was the bathroom though a little compact. There seemed to be no kettle in our room, even though there was teabags and sugar. The carpet was a bit dated. The night we came a bulb blew near the door and an electrician was up within half an hour to fix it promptly which was good. The hotel itself has mixed parts. The dining room was a bit of an anti-climax as you would have expected to be waiting on, but there was a quite a small buffet. We did not sample the cooked breakfasts but the continental breakfasts were acceptable. We did not stay for lunch or dinner as we ate out in london but it didn't look promising. The bar was good, though a little aged and the foyer was done up nicely. In the past reviews, many have commented about the neighbourhood. It is quite pleasant and very close to it there are lovely millionaires houses which are quite sweet when we took a walk. It is in a triangle of three tube stations, however it is a little out of the distance for a short walk so take a taxi! The neighbourhood itself has some nice shops and in the local park you can see the BT tower in the distance. It is fairly quiet and in some parts - reserved. There are some lovely buildings there. Overall, a mixed experience.

Reviews.Title: “good location, excellent value”
Reviews.Author: NWPDWR
Reviews.Content: This hotel is perfectly located if you want to explore north London on foot. The hotel is within walking distance of Hamstead Heath and there are plenty of nice gastro pubs and cafes around. If you want to go into central London, there is a bus stop outside the hotel or the tube station is 5 mins walk. The hotel is not modern but it is clean enough and the service is very efficient. We didn't eat at the hotel, so can't comment on the food.

Reviews.Title: “The best hotel in London”
Reviews.Author: benitomussolini
Reviews.Content: Absolutely splendid, good value, near to Primrose Hill, what more could you want. The manager here is definitely doing something right, food was great, bar was great, room service was sublime. Thank you for an excellent holiday!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely location - nasty hotel”
Reviews.Author: Love2travel22
Reviews.Content: My company put me up here for a few nights in June, and I was not too happy about it! The location is great. Lovely wealthy area and lots of nice restaurants and a few shops nearby. Within Zone 1 and a choice of 2 tube stations with only a few stops to get into Central London. Free car parking is very good - however, you need to get to the hotel before 5 to secure a space or you'll need to find a space on the road which is pay & display until about 6pm. The car parking spaces are also very small and awkward to fit in. The hotel itself is pretty nasty. Very dated and not particularly clean. The bedrooms have floral walls, floral carpet, floral curtains and dark wood furniture so they feel very chintzy and claustrophobic and smell a bit fusty and you can hear very clearly what's going on in the next rooms. It needs a good refurb. Had a problem with the bed in the room and the night staff were very rude and un-helpful. Breakfast was pretty awful - I'd recommend going to one of the nice cafe's up the road instead. The tea and coffee (if you can call it that) in the jugs was awful, and the cooked breakfast looked like it had been out under the lights for hours. Overall - if you just want a cheap bed for the night and don't plan to spend much time there, then ok, but I would not recommend for a leisure stay.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, reasonably comfortable, old fashioned hotel”
Reviews.Author: beautifulvoice1990
Reviews.Content: This hotel looks not too bad from the outside. Spinning door impossible to get case through and a badly manned reception. Quick check-in once staff arrived however and small climb to room on second floor. Halls very dark and old fashioned yet clean. Room was clean and quite comfortable with a surprisingly nice bathroom. Beds had no headboard however and cups for tea were dirty Breakfast good yet staff very impatient and badly organised Would look elsewhere before staying again, average experiance

Reviews.Title: “Not perfect but ok for the price”
Reviews.Author: ClaretAl
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 2 nights at the end of June. The hotel is an easy 10-15 minute stroll from Chalk Farm tube station in a pleasant residential area close to shops and pubs. Approaching the hotel it does look a little scruffy from the outside and I think it's fair to say it is in need of refurbishment (which is underway). Having said that there was nothing really wrong with our 5th floor room. It was quite spacious and the room, bedding and bathroom were all clean (although air conditioning or a fan would have been welcome as there was very little ventilation due to window opening restrictors and London was in the middle of a heatwave at the time so it was very difficult to keep cool enough to sleep!) Whilst I agree with a previous poster that the cold meats should have been kept under cover we thought the breakfast was fine. Plenty of choice and the food was hot and tasty and we never had a problem getting a hot tea or coffee from the flasks and the waiter removed our used plates promptly. Sure it's not The Ritz and there are areas of the hotel that need sprucing up and some of the public areas did look a little tired and worn but overall it served our purposes as we were only in the hotel a few hours overall and for what we paid (around Â£70 a night including breakfast) we thought it was fair value for money for a London hotel just 10 minutes by tube from the centre.

Reviews.Title: “Dirty, dingy and disgusting”
Reviews.Author: glengormless
Reviews.Content: Approaching the hotel, we thought it looked dirty but we were wrong, it wasn't dirty, it was filthy! We had to clean the bathroom before we could use it, the 'cleaner' had left her short black hairs everywhere and it stank of smoke and damp. I didn't mind that the furniture was old and needed replaced, I can cope with tired but not dirty. Breakfast was also vile, I heard one of the waiters tell another to go get some more bacon from the microwave! My daughter couldn't get her knife through the croissant it was so stale. The toast was set out on an old tray, still trying to work out how long it had been there. They seemed to use the cheapest of everything, poor quality sausages and bacon etc, even the serviettes would have taken a layer of skin off your face! Tea and coffee was served in flasks on the side of the serving table, again not sure how long they had been there, but the drinks were cold. There were no pats of butter, just a large bowl filled with cubes/slices of margarine floating in water that had been cut out of a tub! What worried me was that the cheese and hams were on a little side table, not chilled and this was during one of the hottest weekends this year, wasn't going to risk eating that! Eating there was certainly an experience and despite having paid for breakfast, we decided not to try it again after the first day, too risky! We stayed here on a theatre package as it stated that the theatre was 3 miles from the hotel. The taxi from the hotel to the theatre was Â£15, so obviously longer!! It was 2 bus or tube trips away from Camden Market which was a positive, as was the fact that you could leave your luggage there after you had checked out, although you were given such a look of disgust as if you had asked them to hide a dead body! All in all, dirty hotel, vile food, staff who didn't seem interested, would not go back, even if it was free!

Reviews.Title: “Do not stay here at all.”
Reviews.Author: butjan
Reviews.Content: Stayed here thankfully for one night, it is a grubby, tired old hotel, when you arrive it is very untidy outside, we parked our car at the rear of the hotel, clean laundry cages next to dirty greasy bins ans wastepipes, inside it smells stale and greasy, the windows are old and dirty, our room was grubby and shabby, dusty wardrobes, we left our clothes in our baggage , mildew around windows on the surrounding walls, curtains stained with damp stains, breakfast was passable but only just we only ate part of it and left the tea and coffee as the cups were greasy. This hotel should not be taking in guests it need closing down until it is cleaned and redecorated.

Reviews.Title: “HAPPY STAY: We would stay again - friendly staff and clean place”
Reviews.Author: GeneralJumbo
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed at this hotel during the time I received my MBE at Buckingham Palace (28 May 09). It, ideally, fitted in with a National Holidays week's visit to LOndon and so we booked for that week. It had to be right in order not to spoil this special occasion in my life. It was a great deal all round for us. The room and service we great. All the staff were helpful and friendly, especially a Polish waiter called Victor. Although they had builders at work, even they were respectful not to intrude, etc. We would and perhaps will stay again. The Primrose Hill area is beautful to walk around. Cheers Alec and Audrey

Reviews.Title: “Everything OK”
Reviews.Author: MrAPeterborough
Reviews.Content: We used this hotel as a base as we were going to a gig in Camden. I was a little concerned after reading some of the other reviews but every thing was ok . Considering what this hotel cost you could not complain . Plus free parking in London is a bonus . .

Reviews.Title: “Hotel was excellent but don't eat there.”
Reviews.Author: SocOps
Reviews.Content: Excellent stay at the hotel. Clean sheets and towels everday. Room was clean ,no mold, cobwebs or other nasties you can find in a hotel in London for under $100 a night. Chalk Farm Tube takes you to city center in about 10 min. Also very close to Camden Market. Also I will make a note on housekeeping very trustworthy. We left 400 GBP on the dresser in our rush to get out the door and it was still there when we got back that evening. American's will find hand towel and bath towels but no washcloths. Beds were not the best in comfort but if you walked ,which you will in London, you will be too tired to care. Lift/elevator worked. Restaraunt : I put this in a seperate paragraph because hopefully you don't base feelings of a review around a hotels restaraunt. The hotel restaraunt has 3 choices of menu. The bar menu, the buffet and then they have this other menu that know one seemed to know when it was good for? The bar menu is simple ,as it should be, but the food quality wasn't up to par for what they were charging. Hamburgers were better quality at a cabbie stop than here. That was my daughter's opinion and ,after tasting both, I agreed. The buffet was dreadful. We tried it once for breakfast. Watery scrambled eggs and luke warm. Bacon was dry and rubbery. The suasage was a mushy and flavourless. All for 21 GBP total for 2 people. Now this is my primary complaint. The morning that we ate breakfast they had run out of glasses for juice. The reason? The staff was fussing over the money in the till and who had paid, who hadn't paid and this was the norm for the restaraunt for our entire visit to the hotel. It took them ten minutes to realize they were out of juice glasses just from their disorganization. I don't really think they have from a customers view thought out how the flow should work. You enter the main lobby and then from there you walk into the bar area and from there is the main dining area. To get a drink form the bar you have to back around the front to the main desk to tell them you want to order. If you approach the main dining area the first thing you see is the till to the right. people we saw were confused as to where to sit in order to get service. Do you sit down first ? Do you pay first? Overall an excellent stay and if we go back to London we would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Did the job!”
Reviews.Author: NickBristol
Reviews.Content: We went to a concert at the Forum in Kentishtown and found this hotel to be in the ideal location to use as a base for the evening concert and then a shopping trip in central London the next day The reception was good and the hotel generally ok - just a bit dated in decor. One of our two rooms was a triple which had a makeshift bed that made us all fall about laughing when we saw it,except the lad who had to sleep in it - i'll say no more! The breakfast was o.k however we struggled to find a clean table to settle down on for our food. Compared to other London Hotels it was the price that attracted us and we got what we paid for. I would use it again as it was quiet and had a relaxed atmosphere but I wouldn't ask for another triple room!

Reviews.Title: “Get what you pay for...fair enough”
Reviews.Author: Gayleyg
Reviews.Content: The decor is 1980's at best. It's jaded, faded or plain old falling apart, if it was your house you'd have had the decorators in years ago. BUT the staff are friendly and the hotel feels safe. It's 20minutes tube journey to Leicester Square and for the same price you'll not even get a hostel with shared bathroom this close to the centre of London. We were there for a Xmas treat and were dashing around doing the tourist things so in total we were in our room for about 8 hours. Value for money and conenience were great but if you want to impress someone or spend a lot of time loungnig in your room go elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Good Service”
Reviews.Author: tricksterjess
Reviews.Content: On reading some of the reviews about this hotel, my initial thought was to to agree about the standard of the rooms being slightly shabby but I liked the lobby and the hotel had an old sort of quaintness about it that I liked. I was woken up early - even though I didn't have to get up early on the Mon morning at 8am by a rattling set of step ladders but then I did see a sign up later that informed residents of work being carried out on that date.My main reason however for feeling that I should write, was to say that I left a very good coat in the wardrobe and upon inquiring to ask if it was still there, was told that it was!! The lady at reception then posted it back to me the next day and I was grateful to receive it.I just thought that it was good service as I definately didn't expect to see it again...

Reviews.Title: “Not bad for the price !!!”
Reviews.Author: Ipsen
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for four nights in Oct 2008,the booking was made via a travell company who provided transport from the North all for less than Â£ 200 p/p, this made the Hotel price about Â£40 / night which was very good. The Hotel itself is aged and in need of updating,the rooms were warm and apropiate for what we needed the water was hot and the room cleaned daily. The resteraunt was understaffed and sometimes we had to wait for a table to be prepared. The food was dull and boring but edible and as much as you could eat,the same applies for breakfast. The location is ok and Swiss Cottage station is 15 mins walk or you can walk to the main attractions in 90 mins . I wouldnt pay full price for this hotel unless i was stuck without a choice but as a package it was ok

Reviews.Title: “Consider Alternatives Before Booking”
Reviews.Author: jasejc
Reviews.Content: OK get this hotel into context. It is in a good location with great access to Central London by tube or bus. It is not expensive, myself and my wife stayed for two nights (room 516) at a rate of either Â£89 (double room only) or Â£110 (double room and breakfast) per night and one great perk is the fact that parking is free for the duration of the stay. In terms of the quality of the hotel it is extremely poor. The rooms are very dated, the furniture is shabby, the beds should have been burned ten years ago and the whole place does smell with a combination of damp, decay, cooking fat and stale beer. We did try the breakfast one morning but gave up after the first mouthful, the scrambled egg were luke warm and had a texture as though they had been mixed on the floor of the car park prior to cooking, the hash browns - well lets just say it is a rare talent that can make hash browns with no potato. I literally spat out my first attempt at eating them. In terms of cleanliness - the bed linen was changed each day but due to the overall 'feel' of the hotel nothing ever seemed to be clean, the whole place just feels rank. The staff were very good, efficient, courteous and knowledgeable and you just have to feel sorry for them as I am sure they have to contend with a constant barrage of complaints throughout their working day so how they manage to maintain such a positive front is remarkable. So who is this hotel suited to? romantic weekend - no, family holiday - no, suffers of allergies - no, business executives - no, construction staff working away from home - yes. Don't want this to sound pretentious but in it's current state that is exactly the type of client that this hotel will suit, guys who are away from home during the week who are out to work early, do a hard days graft and then want to get back, have a shower, a few drinks in the bar and then bed - perfect. But the main advantage of this hotel is the free parking - if you are in Central London for a few days mid week it will cost at least Â£10 per day for the congestion charge, then say to park a car in a central London car park for a day another Â£40, so when you factor this into account, staying at the hotel and then getting the tube into London for day, you can reduce the room rate by a good Â£50 per day so really the best way of looking at this hotel isn't to say it is a hotel at all, but to look upon it as an upmarket car park! As the title to this review suggests consider other alternatives before booking into this hotel, otherwise I am sure the vast majority of people WILL be disappointed. Do not book the breakfast, there are two good cafe's within a two minute walk that offer great food, cheaper than the cost of the breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Poor Value,Shabby Rooms.”
Reviews.Author: stevemacAshbourne
Reviews.Content: Hello, I hated this hotel,the price was simply a rip off.The hotel maybe well positioned,but the rooms are awful.There is no matress cover,the beds are uncomfortable.The rooms are falling apart. I complained on the day we arrived,but did not get anywhere.And wrote to the hotel on but no one had the decency to reply.They have your money and that's it. How can this place get 3 stars?? I will never stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Do not stay here..”
Reviews.Author: LadyPCheshire
Reviews.Content: This hotel is badly in need of renovation. Not only that but it is very unkempt. Wallpaper falling off, stains on the bed, smelly and very dirty room. You would not let your dog stay in this! I'm not sure how they have the nerve to charge the prices they do. I think I would rather sleep on a park bench! What more can i say..dont waste your money. There are far nicer and CLEANER places in London.

Reviews.Title: “Do Not Stay Here!!”
Reviews.Author: mariellamarbella
Reviews.Content: Do not stay at this horrible hotel! We arrived there for a late check-in on a Saturday night to find a raucous nightclub going on in the hotel bar and the lobby filled with degenerate teenagers (we overheard one saying to another: "Touch my iPhone and I'll slice you!") Not exactly a warm welcome. As we were at the front desk, we heard another guest complaining to the receptionist about the noise from the nightclub. The receptionist rudely told him there was nothing more they could do but have the music turned down, and that the party would end by 1:30am! (Sorry - isn't a hotel for sleeping?!) This was not a good sign. However, because we had pre-paid for the room, we went ahead and checked in anyway. Unfortunately our room was on the 1st floor directly above the nightclub/bar so the noise and base were ridiculously loud and the receptionist refused to move us, claiming all rooms were booked. To make matters worse, the room itself was fithly. There was dust and grime on every surface and the bathroom was repulsive. Not only did it look like it hadn't been cleaned, whomever had last been there didn't even bother to flush the toilet!! Truly disgusting. We tried to settle in eventually, and complained to the hotel night manager several times about the music, and he basically couldn't care less. Seems the management are there more to run a nightclub than they are for the comfort of their guests. After a sleepless night on a hard-as-rock mattress with springs sticking in our backs, you can bet I'll be telling everyone I know to avoid this dump like the plague!

Reviews.Title: “Tatty, yes but value for money...”
Reviews.Author: MrSpeyk
Reviews.Content: This is a hotel in serious need of a make over. The rooms are in a bad state and the reception / bar area are just so dull. However for Â£59 a night and with free parking only minutes from the underground or a short walk into London what can you say. If it's just for the night it is well worth it. Just stay out and use the room for sleep and washing and you're fine. If you are looking for some place decent and comfortable look elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “needs updating”
Reviews.Author: helenarnold66
Reviews.Content: the daily laundry service was spot on. they changed the towels, made the bed, and replenished our drinks. the room was very basic, carpet had seen better days, furniture old, and uncomfortable. bathroom was just ok. the meals were ok, but there was no way i would have paid Â£10.50 for a cooked one, it wasnt worth that. on the second night we asked for sandwiches as we were going to the theatre, and wanted to eat before we left. she was so rude was the lady who brought them , your late she said, it was just ten minutes. i could not believe it, i could have understood if it had been a cooked meal. when we asked for them again the next night, it took them 30 minutes to do a couple of sandwiches, they came squashed in foil, which we hadnt asked for, and it was not even the right filling. and because of the lond wait, it made us late for the theatre. they charge Â£1.10 for 10 minutes use of the internet, thats a joke. it was i suppose somewhere cheap to crash down, but i will never go back there, i thought they were rude, and lack in customer relations experience.

Reviews.Title: “decent hotel”
Reviews.Author: Janichic
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Britannia Hampstead Hotel for 4 nights. I was pleasantly surprised after reading the reviews on tripadvisor. Yes, the beds were uncomfortable. But the room was clean and the hotel was a good value. The location was great, in a residential neighborhood, about a 10 minute walk from the tube. I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Do not stop there!”
Reviews.Author: Raq29
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for one night, The price was very cheap hence I thought the quality of the hotel may be below average and yes it certainly was! The bedding was dirty, the bed base was dirty and the bed creaked liked crazy! The decor would have been fine in the early 1980's but sadly is now a litttle dated. Cannot comment about the food as we didnt eat at the hotel. If you are not phased by cleanliness then this hotel is fine but if you are then steer clear!!

Reviews.Title: “Horrible stay”
Reviews.Author: DedicatedReject
Reviews.Content: I stayed there for one night with a friend. We got the room cause it was cheap and close to the concert we were going to the next day. The second we walked in the door we noticed the old torn wallpaper. The bedspread had white stains on it. One can only assume what they were from. The window had cracks all along the frame. On top of it all, the toilet needed to be flushed 5-6 times just to get it to go down. The bathroom sink was cracked. The tile in the bathroom was dirty and also cracked. I only spoke to one person on the staff, and she didn't seem very willing to be helpful. I was just glad it was for only one night and because of the concert we didn't even stay in the room for more than just sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Smoky smelly room”
Reviews.Author: SteveTCheltenham
Reviews.Content: Just the most appalling experience - room stank of old fags - bad furniture - lumpy bed dreadful service - peeling paint work -sleep on a park bench but don't stay here!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Worst hotel room in 5 years”
Reviews.Author: Spruth
Reviews.Content: Very uncomfortable beds, the base of the beds were dirty, unfriendly staff, lights that hang so low in the rooms you bang your head on them, leaky bath, ill fitting carpet, plates and cutlery left on corridors all day, base of bed was stained, condenstaion on windows all day. Poor breakfast, the whole place felt like it was stuck in the 1970s. A word of warning - this hotel is a sister of the Scarborough Grand which is renound for it's outbreaks for food poisoning.

Reviews.Title: “awful”
Reviews.Author: aarin
Reviews.Content: the room was BIG but the mattress had 2 holes in it with broken "sharp" springs sticking out. We where cold and when we asked for a heater it did not appear. the rooms where tired and the bed linen had old stains, like the walls and carpet. By far the worst food i have ever had for the price. the chips was cooked in old fat, the meat was dry and you could bounce the potatoes up the street. Be ware! eat breakfast at 7 as by 10 you are getting the same food, they do not bring out hot food during the morning, we had to ask for it to be microwaved to heat it up. Check your bill as we booked on line and when we arrived they tried to double the bill.

Reviews.Title: “Not that bad!”
Reviews.Author: luke64
Reviews.Content: My work sent me and a couple of my colleagues to stay here for a 5 days (10th to 14th September). Based on other reviews, I came armed with some air freshener and a brillo (the later fortunately wasn't needed!). Upon entering mine the room has a very strong smell of smoke, which the air freshener soon solved. The following day the room again smelt of smoke, and again rectified by the air freshener, yet the following days after, the room remained smoke free, suggesting the cleaner was smoking in the room! Apart from this, the double room was spacious, with a desk, coffee table, and chairs and a TV with Sky. The bed was comfortable with sheets changed every day, and the shower was neither too hot of too cold and bath wasn't too small. The lavish reception creates false expectations of room quality, as the furnishings and decoration was aged in all our rooms - The whole places feels like it could do with a lick a fresh paint! The block of flats opposite the hotel was a little overbearing, especially since the rooms lack any netting or blinds so you feel rather â€˜exposedâ€™. The reception staff were friendly although there was a small language barrier, and we had a few problems at breakfast with the staff telling us we werenâ€™t booked for breakfast when this wasnâ€™t the case. I guess it were possible we were put in better maintained rooms as we were business customers but the hotel certainly wasnâ€™t as bad as other reviews describe! Although my stay at the Hampstead was OK, I wouldnâ€™t stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Desperately Needing Maintenance”
Reviews.Author: travelingkiwicraig
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for 2 days to join American friends who stayed 9 nights. Our room had an overpowering pungent smell of mould the cause of which was all over the curtains, adjacent wall to the windows and the window pelmet. The photo's we took are daming evidence. our friends from the US never had their sheets changed in 9 nights! and their mattrass had huge stains, including a large blood stain! and a nasty 3 inch spring sticking out of the mattrasss. Photo's are also available of this. Requests to replace mattrass were not actioned. Wallpaper in the room had several edges stuck down with cellotape. Whilst we found the front desk staff very pleasant our meeting with management over our complaints were disappointing and met with disbelief and an offer of less than 10% off the bill !!.

HotelInfo.Name: Britannia Hampstead Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: Primrose Hill Rd | Swiss Cottage, London NW3 3NA, England
